document: Head of Product - Customer Experience (Beauty) Zalando Berlin As Zalando transforms from Europe's leading e-commerce company into The Starting Point for Fashion, Beauty and Lifestyle, this is an exciting time to join us. We are continuously innovating the way we engage with our 30m+ customers to build deeper relationships that see them return again and again. Whether our customer is a makeup enthusiast or looking for a no-fuss skincare product, Beauty is one of the most personal categories in our assortment. As a head of product for our beauty Experience teams you will lead our efforts to create an experience that is tailored to the individual beauty & care needs of Zalando's customers. In your role, you will define and execute the product strategy for our overall beauty customer experience, including the search & browse as well as advice for beauty and our profile & personalisation products. You enable your product managers to build customer centric, data-driven experiences that will revolutionise the way customers buy beauty & care products online and maintain a strong relationship with your design and engineering peers. WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED Act as owner of our Beauty customer experience: set a clear vision, define a 3-5 year strategy and ambitious targets, and then report against and drive towards those. Identify new product opportunities with a customer-centric mindset, select the right solutions to focus on by making business savvy decisions Applying repeatable best practice product methodologies in cross-functional teams incorporating working backwards from the customer, problem discovery, defining & designing solutions, and delivering agreed outcomes. Life high challenge, high support by raising the bar with every product launch you own Be your teams biggest fan through constant coaching and mentoring, and make sure to identify individual growth paths and learning opportunities for each of your team members Be a mentor to other colleagues by showcasing deep expertise in your domain and acting as a role model for successful product management. Build strong working relationships across multiple business and tech teams to collaborate and remove unnecessary complexity starting with the customer and working backwards to derive scalable solutions. Prepare customer centric, concise written narratives about problems worth solving for your customer to discuss with senior leadership and enable efficient decision making and prioritisation WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR Product methods & tools: you have a strong track record of envisioning, developing and building successful consumer-facing products, ideally in an online service marketplace or e-commerce environment. You are able to define and explain a product strategy for your area to senior stakeholders Customer mindset: you have the ability to quickly understand customer needs and turn them into remarkable products. You are experienced in interpreting insights with user research and product discovery to provide the voice of the customer, creating the right stories that give our users what they need (and not just what they want). Multiple domains: you have experience in working closely with multiple cross functional teams in Design, Engineering and Data Science. Analytical communicator: your message is crisp, clear and to the point. You involve your relevant stakeholders timely along the product development process. In addition, you bring the analytical skills and rigor to analyze large sets of data, evaluate opportunities and autonomously make well-founded product decisions. Business Acumen: you have deep understanding for business KPIs, you can read a P&L and are able to discuss CLV contributions your teams are making. Effective networker: you can own and drive topics without much central steering. You build your personal network and identify interdependencies or sources of mutual value to create optimal solutions. Continuous learner: You define your own KPIs in order to measure your and your team's impact and the success of the product. You have the passion and drive to keep up with product innovations, whilst refining your toolset and at the same time mentoring your colleagues. Beauty & Care Industry knowledge: Past experience in the field of product management in the Beauty & Care industry or an affinity for the beauty & care domain and understanding of the industry is a plus. PERKS AT WORK Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings Extensive on-boarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations) We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. ABOUT ZALANDO Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 20 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 32 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use. A key to the success of Europe's busiest fashion logistics network is continuously advancing our technology and processes. By pushing ourselves to think smarter and adapt faster, our teams are setting new levels of excellence for the industry while meeting the complex needs of our customers, helping people connect to fashion in ways that were never previously possible. Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Professor in » Information Systems « The Technical University of Munich (TUM) is setting up a new innovative Center for Informatics at the TUM Campus Heilbronn. A total of 9 professorships in the fields of computer engineering, theoretical and practical computer science, endowed by the Dieter Schwarz Foundation, are to be established. The TUM herewith invites applications for the position of Professor in » Information Systems « to begin as soon as possible. The position is a W2 fixed-term position (6 years) with tenure track option to a tenured W3 position (Associate Professor) or a tenured W3 (Associate or Full) position. Scientific Environment The Heilbronn region is a strong and successful high-tech region in Europe with many cooperation opportunities and a wide variety of educational institutions. The professorship belongs to the Department of Informatics – in the future to the TUM School of Computation, Information & Technology – and will be part of the TUM Campus Heilbronn, a new vibrant center for research and teaching. With the Center for Digital Transformation and the Global Center for Family Enterprise of the TUM School of Management, TUM Campus Heilbronn provides a multitude of possibilities for scientific collaborations in the areas of management, engineering and digital transformation. The new Center for Informatics complements the TUM Campus Heilbronn with a digital profile and bridges the divide between management and digitalization. Its focus will be in information engineering – a key component in the digital transformation of companies.  Responsibilities The responsibilities include research and teaching as well as the promotion of early-career scientists in the full spectrum of Informatics. Together with the professorships in economics of the TUM School of Management funded since 2018, the new professors will engage in research and teaching at the interface of management and technology. We seek to appoint an expert in the research area of Information Systems with a focus on Business Process Management and Enterprise Architecture. The teaching load includes courses in the university’s bachelor’s and master’s programs. The successful candidate will also participate in building up and shaping the profile of the new Center for Informatics as well as establish new study programs at the TUM Campus Heilbronn.  Qualifications We are looking for candidates who have demonstrated excellent achievements in research and teaching in an internationally recognized scientific environment, relative to the relevant career level (please see www.tum.de/en/faculty-recruiting-faq/ for further information). A university degree and an outstanding doctoral degree or equivalent scientific qualification, as well as pedagogical aptitude, are prerequisites. Substantial research experience abroad is expected.  Our Offer Based on the best international standards and transparent performance criteria, TUM offers a merit-based academic career path for tenure track faculty from Assistant Professor through a permanent position as Associate Professor, and on to Full Professor. The regulations of the TUM Faculty Recruitment and Career System apply. TUM provides excellent working conditions in a lively scientific community, embedded in the vibrant research environment of the Campus Heilbronn. The TUM envi-ronment is multicultural, with English serving as a common interface for scientific interaction. The TUM Munich Dual Career Office (MDCO) provides tailored career consulting to the partners of newly appointed professors. The MDCO assists the relocation and integration of new professors, their partners and accompanying family members.  Your Application TUM is an equal opportunity employer and explicitly encourages applications from women. Applications from disabled persons with essentially the same qualifications as other candidates will be given preference. Application documents should be submitted in accordance with TUM’s application guidelines for professors. These guidelines and detailed information about the TUM Faculty Recruitment and Career System are available at www.tum.de/faculty-recruiting. Here you will also find TUM’s information on collecting and processing personal data as part of the application process.  Please send your application no later than October 31, 2021 to the Dean of the Department of Informatics, Prof. Dr. Hans-Joachim Bungartz, Email address for applications: bewerbung.dekanat@in.tum.de. Kontakt: bewerbung.dekanat@in.tum.de

Senior/Expert Engineer (f/m/d) for Busines Process Intelligence Data & Semantics SAP 10178 Berlin What we offer Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!  Summary & Role Information We are looking for a Senior/Expert Engineer joining the Business Process Intelligence Data and Semantics unit. You will work in a fast-growing team with Product Owners, Data Scientists, and Development / Business Architects developing BPI data services.  As a Senior/Expert Engineer, you … Eager to mine insights from process data across customers to build relevant data services Work as a fully contributing team member with independent planning & execution responsibilities to deliver features end-to-end Work on problems of complex scope through general usage of data architecture principles and standard programming concepts Translate business requirements into technical specifications, including data streams, integrations, transformations, and processing Define and evolve a content driven development process ensuring a systematic and repeatable approach for developing new data services Ensure all sign-off criteria (quality, performance, etc.) are met before completion of development Quickly acquire proficient development skills in new areas and technologies in alignment with the team's priorities Foster the culture of innovation in day-to-day work w.r.t product, process, developer efficiency, etc. Communicate proactively on the risk of delivery/support required from all the stakeholders   Role Requirements Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, engineering, or information systems Knowledge Data Lake architecture and principles Knowledge about Semantics web principles and technologies Professional experience in programming for general-purpose languages such as Java, JavaScript, or Python Excellent understanding of Databases, Content Architectures, API Design Profound knowledge about the entire SAP cloud software development lifecycle, product standards, and delivery processes Very good team player with appropriate soft skills   Work Experience 5+ years in Software Development, Track record with the delivery of SAP products from ideation to customer adoption a plus 2+ years of work experience in delivering, managing, and operating cloud services Experience in building and running data services a plus Experience in One-Data-Platform and/or Azure Datalake Services is a plus Experience with the content-driven development process and continuous integration and delivery Result-driven leadership at a global level in matrixed structures across multiple locations   About the team Building on SAP's intelligent enterprise strategy it is the mission of Business Process Intelligence to assist our customers in navigating through their digital transformation, help them understand and improve their business processes in a data-driven way. Our purpose is to help our customers innovate in an ever-changing world!  #businessprocessintelligence #SAPBPICareers #womenatsap #hotjobsatsap  We are SAP SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.  Our inclusion promise SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world. SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. Requisition ID:304176 | Work Area: Software-Development Operations | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - Germany

Enterprise Account Executive Fero Labs Düsseldorf Homeoffice Fero’s vision is to empower the global industrial sector to become as innovative and adaptive as the technology sector. Our self-service software product empowers customers with explainable and causal machine learning models and enables them to achieve meaningful waste reduction, reduce costs and boost environmental sustainability. * We are a team with academic roots and believe in the importance of fostering a culture of learning - welcoming knowledge, learning from mistakes and constant innovation. After closing our Series A, led by Innovation Endeavors, we are now growing our go-to market team. By joining Fero, you’ll not only gain valuable enterprise sales experience at a high-growth start-up, but have measurable impact how factories operate, use our planet’s resources, and affect global climate. * * The role * * The Enterprise Account Executive will be responsible for driving the sales process and will work closely with our CEO to drive revenue targets. You will cultivate relationship and business opportunities targeting large, enterprise accounts in industries from automotive to steel. * * You’ll be serving as a trusted advisor by working with prospective customers to understand business objectives while working alongside our team of data science experts and engineers to provide solutions and align our roadmap with customer feedback. * * What you’ll do Identify leads and new business opportunities through strategic prospecting across industries. Close new business to meet or exceed revenue goals. Drive the sales process while fostering relationships with multi-layer stakeholders. Work collaboratively with internal partners to service key accounts. Gain insight and understand your prospects business challenges and communicate Fero value proposition and solutions strategy to customers and prospects. Impact sales efficiency by building out Fero’s sales playbook * * Qualifications 3+ years of work experience in a B2B sales and/or account management role, with a proven track record in client retention, upsells, and or customer acquisition. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. Ability to develop business cases that communicate requirements, business strategy and objectives to enterprise level prospects. High level of emotional intelligence and the ability to effectively engage internal and external stakeholders. An excitement to learn about industrial continuous improvement ideas, such as Six Sigma and Lean. * * At Fero We... * * Provide employees with a company sponsored gym membership from Urban Sports Club. Cover a company sponsored Free Jobrad bike membership. Believe it’s important to rejuvenate and offer a 35 days vacation policy. Offer employees their choice of hardware. Provide a yearly stipend to invest in your continuing education. You can spend the money on online courses, coding classes, conference tickets, books, etc. Accommodate a remote/hybrid work model with remote online events (workouts, coffee chats, team events, games, etc.) * Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Pay: 55,000.00€ - 65,000.00€ per year Experience: sales: 3 years (Preferred) Language: German, English (Preferred) Work Remotely: Yes

Operations Architect (m/f/x) KONUX GmbH München Vorübergehend im Homeoffice The Role As an Operations Architect at KONUX, you will design and oversee our operational IT system landscape to ensure all our operational customer processes run seamlessly in a scalable, automated and fully integrated manner. You will create transparency on all key metrics for the operational processes to ensure business decisions can be taken quickly and based on reliable data. You will apply your technical knowledge and expertise in the vendor selection and integration for state-of-the art tools in close collaboration with all relevant process owners in the company. You will lead the implementation of all operational tools for our operational teams. Your Responsibilities Responsible for the KONUX operational platform architecture to be able to run our customer services in an efficient and scalable way (incl. ERP, Monitoring, Ticketing, CRM, Inventory Management, Device Management, Configuration Management etc.) Ensure cybersecurity best practices and the latest standards are applied Prioritize implementation sequence with stakeholders and promote architecture improvements by highlighting user benefits Provide guidance on how to leverage the latest technologies to create the most effective solutions in the operations area Play an active part in the continuous improvement of operational processes quality You will enable a clear system structure for data ownership, interfaces and system integration Support interface discussion between operational teams and engineering department Your Profile Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or another relevant field 4+ years working experience in IT tool and software development area and 2 years experience driving operational architecture across multiple teams, spanning operational tools in the areas of ERP, Configuration, Monitoring, CRM, ticketing Proven experience interface integration of several off-the-shelf tools In-depth understanding of security standards and data integration from mixed sources in different domains Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly Familiar with IT Service Management (ITSM) and good understanding of operational processes Experience working in an Agile development environment Ability to multitask, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced, collaborative environment Strong system-level troubleshooting skills Experience in working with and influencing a wide variety of people and personalities globally distributed Do Not Apply If... You have never worked with off-the-shelf operational tools You do not understand the techniques of IT service management and their processes You don’t like to be hands-on when it comes to the integration of different systems You don’t speak English fluently You don’t like to work in a fast paced environment with changing priorities Enabling a Data-Driven World At KONUX, we are empowering the rail industry by building the best possible predictive analytics solutions for our customers. We strive to help industrial companies improve their maintenance and performance decision making in a data-driven world. A career at KONUX is for those who want to be at the forefront of analytics, working to make notable improvements to train reliability which affects hundreds of commuters every day. Our culture prioritizes the customer first, and all employees are expected and empowered to take ownership of their daily responsibilities. If this sounds like the type of environment you thrive in, then we want to hear from you! Equal Opportunity At KONUX, we focus on results. We believe that a diverse team achieves better results faster. So here’s the deal: You bring in your very own perspective. We promise to judge your qualifications and performance, not your age, sex, religion, skin color, gender identity, family status or disability. What We Offer The opportunity to play a decisive role in shaping a company during its pivotal growth stage alongside a diverse, multinational team A competitive salary with equity (all permanent KONUX employees have equity!) 27 days (+1 day on every work anniversary for 3 years) Remote team events and opportunities to socialize with colleagues, also during Covid Flexible working conditions and home office equipment, also after Covid Job Type: Full-time

MARKETING MANAGER - CONVERSION RATE OPTIMIZATION (F/M/D) Sanity Group aims to improve the quality of life for people in Europe through the meaningful use of cannabinoids. We believe that there’s a lot of untapped potential in nature that can contribute to a healthier way of life for many people. In addition to medicine, our focus is also on cannabinoid-based wellbeing and cosmetic products. In parallel, Sanity Group is also working and researching new medical products, innovative dosage forms and technological products & services to further develop the cannabis industry.  Our mission is to help unlock the full potential of the cannabis plant and its ingredients in order to make them accessible for people.  Tasks  You collaborate with different departments and stakeholders (Tech, SEO, Performance Marketing, Customer Service, Content, Design) to ensure a consistent content and user experience and to optimize each conversion path throughout the different online user journeys on our websites and landing pages You analyze and synthesize data to understand how our target groups navigate our websites and and you identify opportunities for growth and scale You create hypotheses, set up test-roadmaps and conduct A/B and multivariate tests to continuously optimize the UX ensuring adherence to relevant KPIs You quickly identify and understand key conversion rate optimization issues and work cross-functionally to speed up the hypothesis-to-solution implementation loop You ensure that all test results are documented and visually prepared, discuss your findings with all relevant stakeholders and derive recommendations for new and innovative ideas to further improve website and content development Requirements  You can identify yourself with our mission to revolutionize the European cannabis market and want to make your contribution You stand behind our people first culture and can identify with our values “Act entrepreneurial”, “Be transparent” and “Continuously improve” You have proven experience in UX, website and content analytics and optimization ideally in a fast growing and agile environment You have a data driven approach to making decisions You have experience in setting up and conducting A/B test for website optimization You have an understanding of SEO, SEM, and inbound marketing best practices You are used to work with common web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics), Testing tools /eg. Optimizely and VWO) and SEO tools (e.g. Searchmetrics) Your organisational skills are excellent and you easily oversee and hold all strings of projects together You have outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities You have excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills You are fluent in English and possess a good German knowledge Benefits  We provide flexible working hours in an innovative and agile working environment We cherish uncomplicated interaction with each other in flat hierarchies and with short decision paths We foster an open culture and agile way of working with a lot of space to create and develop ideas We pay fair - based on your qualifications and experience We provide internal and external development opportunities, because stagnation means a step backwards We live an error culture with the motto “Fail fast!”, because mistakes make us better if we handle it transparently and learn from it We organize team events for a lot of fun besides work WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW  Sanity Group was founded in 2018 by Finn Age Hänsel and Fabian Friede. The company now employs a team of over 90 employees in Germany at its headquarters in Berlin and its production facility near Frankfurt am Main. Sanity Group brands include Vayamed (pharmaceuticals), Sanity Science (research and production), Belfry Medical (medical devices), VAAY (CBD products) and This Place (natural cosmetics). The company is supported strategically and financially by venture capital companies such as HV Capital as well as by various business angels such as music producer , TV entertainer Klaas Heufer-Umlauf, football player Mario Götze and model Stefanie Giesinger.  SOUNDS GOOD?  We are looking forward to receiving your application!

UX/Experience Consultant Company Description We Dream. We Do. We Deliver. As a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation company, we partner with Top 500 companies in the DACH region and in Eastern Europe. Originally from Switzerland, Merkle DACH was created out of a merger Namics and Isobar - two leading full-service digital agencies. Our 1200+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built, through providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, Mobile, Social Media, Intranet and CMS. We are part of the global Merkle brand, the largest brand within the dentsu group, who shares with us a network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries. You have a thirst for knowledge and are fascinated by digital possibilities? We are currently looking for an inquisitive UX Consultant who will bring new impulses to our team consisting and enthrall our clients such as Siemens, Gardena, DA Direkt, Bosch, Mercedes, Breitling, with unique digital experiences. Job Description You will be responsible for creative and smart digital concepts and solutions while considering the requirements of our clients as well as the needs of the respective target group You will find and extract insights from user research activities (interviews, field studies, usability tests) and thereby create the basis for user-centered design You will transform comprehensive content and complex processes into comprehensible information architecture and create first interface structures (e.g. flows wireframes, prototypes) You will take part in customer workshops and internal ideation workshops (e.g. to prepare pitches) You will learn from proficient Experience Consultants and Designers and gain more and more responsibility for projects Qualifications A completed university degree in computer science, business administration, psychology or design, or a comparable qualification Ideally, first professional experience in the conceptual environment as well as in dealing with user-centered design/design thinking You have both creative as well as analytical thinking skills and are able to understand complex processes and connections High level of quality awareness – you appreciate the finer details but don’t get lost in them You’re a communication talent and team player You have a solid technical know-how of current web technologies You have a keen eye for design as well as a sense for trends in the UX environment Additional Information We work with highly motivated people, who support and enrich each other. We live the possibilities of the digital world through home office, meaning you can work anywhere with flexible (annual) working hours. We also value face-to-face exchanges - coffee or tea, biscuits or fruit are all welcomed on board and shared throughout our offices. If you ever feel the need to take a break from the digital world, we love to get hands on together and use pens, paper, and whiteboards for brainstorming sessions. Need to clear your head? Hit the foosball table, PlayStation, massage bench or yoga mat. For networking and (brain) food, we offer regular exchange formats, like meetings, tech labs and more. Not enough? We are full believers in education and support training, whether it be internally or externally. We support you. If you feel inspired by us, we’ll probably be inspired by you. Join us now and apply online to make sure we match each other’s expectations. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We welcome all qualified candidates - regardless of your gender or background, please indicate your salary expectations and possible entry date. We look forward to hearing from you! Personal consultancies - we only work with selected partners. Your contact Sara Herrmann Talent Acquisition Teamlead Germany Telefon: +49 69 365 059 301

Intern Finance and Business Intelligence (f/m/d) Solytic Berlin Your future achievements  This is your chance taking your knowledge gained from the university into business. If you want to challenge yourself and gain a broad experience in Finance and Business Intelligence this is how you should start. We'll be supporting you with a great onboarding and everything that you need to get better in your job.  Main tasks for you will look like as follows: \* You'll support dedicated ongoing projects in the intersection of business intelligence and finance; namely,  In addition, you will get involved in general data and administrative tasks of the day-to-day business of a startup from a finance and BI perspective. Your skills  You are a master student or have just finished your bachelor studies in business administration or other relevant studies, with the main subjects controlling / finance / data / analytics or comparable You have very goodanalytical skills and numerical understanding. You expect the internship to take two to five months. You have a strong learning and can-do attitude, meaning, you feel comfortable with asking questions and interacting with different people, you are intrigued by the idea of bringing value to the company. You are a rational acting employee, that is, you are clear in managing priorities, expectations and stakeholders of projects and present your decisions and positions on a sound set of arguments. You are able to deliver results reliably and on time, applying consistent and careful working methods. Practical experience in data science, business intelligence/operational exellence or controlling is a plus Good knowledge of German (C1 or higher) and English (C1 or higher) is a must. Experience with R, SQL or other quantitative tools is a plus. What's in it for you?  An unbeatable and motivated team with lots of humor and positive energy Comprehensive insight into the various growth phases of an innovative digital start-up A steep learning curve guaranteed Close cooperation with Senior Managers and Management A varied and challenging job with plenty of room for initiative, independence, responsibility and processes in the company Centrally located office in Berlin-Mitte About us  Solytic is a clean-tech startup developing an AI-based software to monitor and improve the performance of solar PV systems. Our vision is to build a centralized platform for a decentralized ecosystem around the world, using data to connect the needs and potentials of solar with offers from service providers to increase profitability. Our solution enables customers to make smart, data-driven decisions on how to economically optimize their system throughout the entire lifecycle.  Solytic stands for a sustainable future, where automation drives lower costs, higher revenues and extends the life cycles of systems. Today's 25 millions solar systems will need to grow to over 1 billion worldwide to meet the Paris Agreement’s targets. Needless to say - the solar market is about to go into hyper-growth.  Together with our strong investors such as Vattenfall and EWE as well as partners such as Microsoft, we are at the forefront of pushing the digital boundaries for solar to fight climate change. As the fastest growing solar software startup in the world, our mission is to accelerate our growth even further with our highly scalable software only approach to automate top performance for solar PV.

Associate Technical Architect JOB DESCRIPTION ROLE: Associate Technical Architect LOCATION: Anywhere is Europe WHAT WILL YOU BRING TO THE ROLE · Experience with building & maintaining complex, scalable, and distributed systems · Good understanding of Software Engineering and Computer Science principle · Ability to formulate software solutions from scratch is essential · Hands-on experience in Linux administration and troubleshooting · Creative approach to problem-solving · Ability to define SLIs and SLOs · Fluency in the English language both spoken and written · Additional experience in networking, security, storage is an advantage, as well as experience working with Apache Kafka and/or Apache Flink RESPONSIBILITIES · You’ll be responsible for the reliability and scalability aspects of a large-scale distributed streaming platform based on Apache Kafka and Apache Flink, carrying 4M+ messages a second across thousands of topics and dozens of clusters. · As well as working independently, you will also participate in making critical technical decisions within the team and across the wider department. · Architect, write and implement software that improves the stability, scalability, availability, and latency of the streaming platform infrastructure · Own multiple services and have the autonomy to do what suits the business and our customers · Construct effective systems to monitor the health of your system, and to handle outages · Build and run capacity tests to manage the growth of your systems · Plan for reliability by designing systems to work across our multinational data centers · Share the on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for incidents · Working in close collaboration with multi-functional teams Job Types: Full-time, Contract Salary: 445.00€ - 450.00€ per day Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Remotely: Yes

Cloud Support Engineer EDB Stuttgart The world loves Postgres. If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you'll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the lid of a nearby laptop. EDB has a lot to do with that. We've been major contributors to Postgres since the beginning, and we are proud to call thousands of boundary pushing customers our partners. Proud though we are, we are not resting on our laurels. There's plenty of work to do. The good news is that everything we do will impact Postgres, which is to say that it will impact the world. No pressure. As a Cloud Support Engineer for EnterpriseDB's Cloud experience, you will be acting as our customer guide to understanding product use, best practices, and common strategies for a successful Postgres configuration and management. This role requires the ability to both analyze and communicate effectively with our customers to help them understand, implement and use these products. This role reports to [insert here depending on region] and will be responsible for learning, applying and collaborating in improving our customer experience and product value. Your voice is an advocate for our customers and a guide of confidence and assistance to our customers. Responsibilities Work directly with customers to provide in-depth technical troubleshooting and recommend appropriate workaround(s) and solutions for Postgres, our Cloud experience and customer common-use tooling. Collaborate with senior and principal support engineers to triage issues, create reproducible test cases, and file Development requests Collaborate with Development resources as it pertains both to our Cloud experience and relevant products. Document solutions, procedures, and standards for customers as well as for internal use. Requirements 2+ years of significant experience with PostgreSQL or 5+ years of experience with Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB, MS SQL, Cassandra or other contemporary database technologies 2-3 years of cloud platform experience in use of compute, networking, storage, application and database services (Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS, or Google GCP preferred) Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent knowledge Working knowledge of PostgreSQL third-party tools (i.e., pgpool, slony, pgbouncer, etc.) Outstanding communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong problem-solving skills for abstract and complex issues Quick-thinking, able to work well under pressure Adept at documenting efforts, actions, and results Experience liaising with Engineering teams Plusses 3-5 years Technical Support experience 1+ years experience with Docker & Kubernetes 1+ years experience in orchestration technologies #LI-Remote We know it takes a unique mix of people and skills to help us in our mission to supercharge Postgres, and we understand that not everyone will check every box. We'd love to hear from you and we want you to apply! EDB is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. EDB was built on a commitment to trust and respect each other and to embrace an array of people and ideas. These values remain at the center of our culture and are key to our company's integrity.

Head of Data Strategy & Management (m|f|d) We are currently seeking a Head of Data Strategy & Management (m|f|d) at our headquarters in Goettingen, Germany (Sartorius Corporate Administration). In this senior leadership position, you will work hand-in-hand with our Business and IT departments to provide overall direction and oversight of the data strategy, governance and management. What you will accomplish together with us Develop a data strategy and framework that reflects the business priorities and leverages data as a growth and transformation driver Enable the company to deliver the required data at the right level of quality, supporting business leaders in extracting all relevant insights from it Take the lead for a team of data professionals in charge of data management, data governance and data analytics Lead transformation projects in a matrix organization Actively shape the group wide data culture What will convince us Many years of leadership experience and ability to syndicate senior stakeholders around data topics to mobilize them for action, preferably in a manufacturing environment A passion for data and the ability to drive change management initiatives Hands-on experience of setting up data governance in larger organizations A thorough understanding of data management processes and tools Profound expertise on data quality and data lifecycle management Successful implementation of company Analytics and Data Science standards & practices Strong project management experience in coordinating across a matrix organization Ability to travel as needed Identification with our core values: Sustainability, Openness, Enjoyment What we offer Our ambition is to simplify progress in life science research and the biopharmaceutical industry to help translate scientific findings into new therapeutics faster and more efficiently. So that more people can obtain access to better medicine. More than 11,000 employees at more than 60 production and sales locations worldwide are committed to this vision. And together, we have grown strongly over the past years. Do you also want to contribute to our vision? Grow with us and benefit from working with a Global Player that has kept its familiar atmosphere: Opportunity for international career development: a global network offering seminars and training sessions, expert and manager career paths Open and highly collaborative culture: mutual support within teams and working as equals, team spirit and international collaboration Work-life balance: Working from home at many sites Intelligent working environment: working in smart buildings with the latest technology and equipment Ambitious goals: Sartorius plans to double its sales revenue approximately every five years and expects to grow its global team to approximately 15,000 people in 2025. We look forward to receiving your application. www.sartorius.com/career We look for employees who would like to grow with us and move the innovative life sciences sector forward. In the process, we focus on agile project work, mutual support within teams and working as equals. Sartorius thrives as a company with people who give their very best every day and who are eager to develop personally and professionally. Further insights into our world of work can be found here.

IT Lead Business Consultant – Master Data Platform Services Boehringer Ingelheim Ingelheim am Rhein Vorübergehend im Homeoffice IT Lead Business Consultant – Master Data Platform Services-219903  OUR COMPANY  At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve; after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture.  THE POSITION  As Lead Business Consultant in IT EDS DAI MDPS you will be a member of the Master Data Platform Services team, reporting into the Head of IT EDS Master Data Platform Services. In close collaboration with Business and IT stakeholders, you will drive the development and global deployment of IT solutions in the area of Master Data Management, in order to meet business strategies, objectives and requirements. You will play a key role in defining the future of Master Data Management at BI and you will contribute in transforming BI in a data driven company. This role can be filled either as Business Consultant or as Lead Business Consultant.  Tasks & responsibilities In your new role, you will serve as an expert for existing and new systems and solutions on technical and process level in the area of Data Governance and Master Data Management. In your role as IT business partner you are the key contact to find the right technical solution for the business needs. Moreover, you empower your business colleagues by maximizing the business value via meaningful solutions based on your knowledge around state-of-the-art technology. With your background in project management, you will lead our large agile projects with high complexity end-to-end. Furthermore, you will ensure the alignment of projects with agreed strategic IT roadmaps and target architectures. In the area of Master Data Management, you are interacting with our stakeholders on management and senior management level to enforce process, architecture and roadmap decisions. You work in collaboration with strategic external partners to ensure mutual beneficial relationships. During all phases of computer system lifecycle, you ensure compliant system build, operation and maintenance in accordance with relevant regulations (e.g. GxP) and ITIL. As a champion for agile working methodologies, you spread the mindset within the wider BI organization.  Requirements Master’s degree in Computer Science or comparable qualification Long term experience in IT, including solution system design and roadmap planning Long term professional IT experience, including a proven track record of successful IT implementation projects including system design and roadmap planning Working experience in Data Governance, Master Data Management and other Data related disciplines (Data Modelling, Data Quality, Application Integration) Deep Knowledge of Master Data Management principles and technical solutions (SAP MDG or Informatica MDM) is a must Proven experience in project management of large and complex (agile) IT projects and programs You’re a true fan of the agile and DevOps mindset and successfully convince organizations to learn faster by early feedback Passionate to bring value-adding technology to the business paired with the ability to challenge the status quo Excellent in negotiation and in driving decisions within a larger group of stakeholders Team player and networker with intercultural experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English Willingness to travel internationally from time to time (up to 20%)  EFFECTS OF COVID-19  We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. As a result of COVID-19, we have introduced alternative working arrangements to ensure that our employees can stay safe and healthy, because the health of our employees is among our top priorities. At all company locations, we work remotely whenever possible. Additionally, we are now hosting virtual video interviews for applicants. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the hygiene rules recommended by the Robert Koch Institute. New employees who do not start on site in production or the laboratories are sent the necessary IT equipment, our Welcome Days take place online, and we plan to conduct their onboarding training virtually whenever possible.  WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?  This is where you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives.  We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition, learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth. We also offer a competitive salary, generous amount of vacation time, and numerous benefits towards your wellness & financial health and work-life balance. Plus, an onsite gym (Ingelheim), in-house doctor and best-in-class cafeterias and coffee bars to keep you energized and healthy. To learn more about what benefits could be waiting for you, please visit our Career area.  Want to learn more about us? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.com/  Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.  READY TO CONTACT US?  Please contact our Recruiting EMEA Team, Tel: +49 (0) 6132 77-173173  Not exactly the position you are looking for but have someone else in mind? Share it via the button on the bottom of the page with friends or colleagues who might be interested.  Job - Information Technology Primary Location - Europe-DE-Rhineland-Palatinate-Ingelheim Organization - DE-Boehringer Ingelheim GmbH (Germany) Schedule - Full-time

document: Senior Transparency Specialist At Certara, we accelerate medicines to patients by partnering with life science innovators. In the past 6 years, over 90% of companies that received new drug approvals by the FDA used our software or services. Our integrated and proprietary end-to-end platform with biosimulation, regulatory science, and market access solutions combined with our strong team of scientists and subject matter experts enable our clients to have: informed decision-making & reduced clinical trial burden higher R&D productivity improved patient outcomes & increased patient access to medicines accelerated regulatory approval Certara is a global team that fosters and nurtures a diverse and inclusive culture. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. The collective sum of our individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, and unique capabilities and talent represents a significant part of our culture, our reputation and our achievement. Together with our partners, we use biosimulation and technology-enabled services to transform drug discovery and development across all therapeutic areas and innovative therapies.  Synchrogenix, a Certara Company: Achieving Regulatory Success As Certara’s Regulatory Science division, Synchrogenix accelerates the regulatory submissions of medical innovations worldwide through customized regulatory solutions, including strategy, communications, operations and technology. Synchrogenix is comprised of some of the most respected talent in the industry, including thought leaders, writers and editors, and regulatory submissions specialists. Our people are talented, quality-minded, and client and stakeholder-oriented. Synchrogenix's people are at the core of our success, and our most successful people are: collaborative and value being part of a team experts with a thirst for continued learning consultative with an ability to articulate process and expertise deadline-driven and able to operate in a fast-paced environment  Job Overview: The Senior Transparency Specialist is a leader and subject matter expert in Transparency & Disclosure (T&D) service line who is responsible for oversight, training and mentoring of internal staff as well as having a comprehensive understanding of the organization, organizational process, and structure of T&D deliverables to provide internal and client leadership. The Senior Transparency Specialist demonstrates an understanding of customer needs and expectations and ensures consistency across the products delivered back to the client. The Senior Transparency Specialist keeps up to date on regulations and industry developments in the T&D landscape and trains internal staff as well as clients on the requirements and expectations.  Responsibilities:  Serve as project lead for pilot projects with new clients  Manage client communication for day-to-day T&D operations  Oversee and manage T&D projects in the most efficient and effective manner to complete projects on time and within budget  Proactively advise the client, such as on risks and benefits of modifications to redaction rules, disclosure of data, and writing in plain language  Collaborate with Business Development and Proposals and Contracts teams to ensure that client SOWs correctly capture efficiency and cost impacts for regulatory agency requirements  Train and mentor Transparency specialists  Education, Experience, Training, and Knowledge:  Bachelor’s degree preferred  3 or more years of experience within CRO or pharmaceutical, medical device or biologics industry leading redaction and anonymization  Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite products and Adobe Publishing products  Preferred: Working knowledge of Amazon Workspace  Extensive knowledge of clinical data anonymization related guidance and requirements  Extensive knowledge of clinical trial disclosure requirements  Extensive knowledge of plain language summary requirements  Proven success in team-based environment  Skills & Abilities:  Proficient understanding of corporate processes that impact the service line  Demonstrate solid time management skills and is deadline conscious with strong leadership and management of process  Communicate clear, concise and relevant information in an appropriate business format  Desires challenges, both technical and interpersonal  Can manage changing and competing priorities in a fast-paced environment  Ability to work in a collaborative environment and easily build relationships with others  Action oriented, always seeking new development opportunities to build knowledge and skills  Show flexibility to meet project needs  Proactively maintain working knowledge of transparency regulations and best practices  Ability to independently direct others to complete projects with a proactive approach and little need for detailed instructions  Certara bases all employment-related decision on merit, taking into consideration qualifications, skills, achievement, and performance. We treat all applicants and employees without regard to personal characteristics such as race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental condition, genetic information, military service, or other characteristic protected by law.  #LI-HM

(Senior) Data Scientist (f/m/d) Your mission  Machine Learning (ML) is revolutionizing the way of doing business at a global scale. In business lending, Finiata takes the technological forefront by developing proprietary technology that allows us to take accurate decisions in a fully data driven fashion. YOU will contribute to further develop the in-house all-data-things technology by engineering and productizing novel pipelines and ML models.  Note: This position is open from junior to senior level, depending on each candidate’s expertise  You will: Apply data science in areas like credit risk modeling, affordability and pricing, KPI forecasting, automated model evaluation (AutoML), causality and model interpretability (XAI) Develop machine learning expertise beyond basic supervised and unsupervised learning, mentor and be mentored by other team members Prototype and subsequently operationalize innovative, data-intensive, end-to-end machine-learning-based decision engines Demonstrate your leadership skills and manage a Machine Learning based project or product, which you will define through frequent interactions with experienced financial-services professionals Your profile  Highly motivated with excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills M.Sc or PhD in a quantitative field and/or working experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer Proficiency in Python with ability to translate ideas into prototypes and prototypes into production Experience with working on Machine Learning projects to learn from structured data, as well as, deep knowledge on statistics Fluent written and verbal communication in English As a plus: Deep knowledge of the theory and expertise on the application of Machine Learning PhD in Machine Learning and/or data mining fundamental topics and/or non-trivial applications of ML/DM foundations Top tier academic track on ML/DM conferences (e.g.: KDD, NIPS, ICML, AAAI, ECML/PKDD) Why us?  Get to make an impact on thousands of businesses every day Participate in a self-organized, continuously improving team Work with the best and learn from other competent and brilliant people Be supported to grow and take leadership from day one Get insights and learnings about the financial business and technology Benefit from remote work opportunities, flexible working hours and a Company Holiday on 24th and 31st December Benefit from an office in the centre of Berlin with great perks (Free drinks and fresh fruit, Urban Sports Club membership, Pizza Thursday) Have the option to take German language courses Have the option to bring your best buddy to work. We love dogs! Be paid a competitive salary

Working Student (m/f/d) - Data Science Coriolis Pharma Research GmbH München To support our local team in Martinsried we are looking for a Working Student (m/f/d) - Data Science About us Coriolis Pharma is a globally operating independent service provider for formulation research and development of for a large variety of different (bio)pharmaceutical molecules, including proteins, peptides, nucleic acids, ATMPs, GMOs, vaccines and virus(-like) particles. An interdisciplinary team of highly qualified scientists with many years of experience in the development of (bio)pharmaceuticals supported by an expert scientific advisory board provides cutting-edge service and know-how related to the formulation development of biopharmaceuticals. At our company, we pursue one goal every day: the advancement of medicines to cure people. Our expanding company currently employs about 140 people at two sites. Your tasks At Coriolis Pharma, we are implementing state-of the-art software solutions to digitalize all our laboratory work processes. Our immediate goal is thus to prepare for the implementation of modern data-science solutions. An important aspect of data science is to ensure that the master data entering the system are uniform, accurate, and consistent. To that end, we are looking for a motivated working student who will be responsible for managing the master data. In the position, you will become an expert in modern lab information management systems (LIMS) and how data is handled and visualized behind the scenes. Furthermore, you will learn what role data integrity plays in the field of data science. You are responsible for the integrity of the master data and help define the requirements for data quality You will be the liaison between the scientists and the data science unit You will help ensure that all chemicals, consumables, instrument names, and parameters are consistent in the IT platform Your profile You are studying pharmaceutical science, physics, (bio)informatics, mathematics or engineering and you are still matriculated You enjoy working with an international team You have a very good knowledge of written and spoken English You have a good eye for details, work in a structured way and have a strong interest in data If this sounds exciting to you, then please apply to join our team! Please, visit our website for further information: www.coriolis-pharma.com We are looking forward to your application in English, preferably in a single PDF file. What we offer you We offer a long-term student employment (minimum 3 months) as working student (Werkstudent) with about 4 to 20 hours of work per week during the semester (dependent on your schedule and flexibility); during semester breaks you can increase the work load up to 40 hours per week, if preferred. As a working student, you become a member of the data science unit with your own set of tasks and responsibilities. At the same time, you are part of a fast-developing pharma company getting valuable insights for your future career. Beyond that Coriolis offers a variety of benefits and team activities to its employees.

(Senior) Data Scientist / Data Analyst (m/f/d) CheMondis 50667 Köln If you are passionate about...  ...data and analytical models, CheMondis will be love at first sight. Join us as a Data Scientist / Data Analyst and be part of our agile, cross-functional and international team. You will drive the growth and optimization of the CheMondis marketplace at a very early stage.  Your mission  Aggregation, transformation, analysis, and evaluation of data from multiple data sources Maintaining, evolving, and extending our existing data models in close collaboration with our data engineers Visualization and identification of data patterns and trends Design of customer behaviour models that have a direct impact on the daily business and the long-term development of our products and services Analysis of market dynamics and their impact on new product initiatives Conduction of ad-hoc analysis as well as creation of scalable long-term solutions Close collaboration with product owners and stakeholders in creating and evaluating experiments to verify product hypothesis and direction Identification of critical metrics to understand our business needs and drive our business performance in interdisciplinary collaboration Consultation of end-users on building their own dashboards on top of our data models Your profile  University degree (Bachelor or higher) in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, or Economics and at least 3 years of experience in data analytics (mathematics, statistical analysis, evaluation, and visualization) Profound experience in data exploration and solid knowledge of data mining, and big data analytics techniques Good Knowledge of statistical concepts and techniques as well as proven experience with ad-hoc data analysis tools (e.g., Pandas) Sound SQL knowledge and proficiency in Python, Scala is a plus Solid understanding of software development principles Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills along with the ability to work in a fast-paced startup-like environment Outstanding communication skills and the strong desire to collaborate with engineers, product managers, designers and stakeholders Why join us?  You will be working on an innovative product with an incredibly exciting tech stack - find out more here You will have the opportunity to shape the success story of a „greenfield” project – with a great team of driven experts We offer a unique combination of start-up flexibility with the stability of a corporate investor We share our knowledge and keep it up to date by hosting and participating in conferences, meetups and hackathons You can pick the hardware and software that enables you to deliver the best code We offer an agile environment with a start-up mentality, flat hierarchies, flexible working hours and a competitive salary Our brand-new office is located at the heart of Cologne. If you are not currently living in Germany, we will provide relocation support Last but not least, we offer recurring team events, off-sites, parties and provide free drinks, fruit, snacks, etc.

Lead Data Scientist (m/f/d) About rubarb and the role  rubarb is a fast-growing start-up in the booming financial industry based in Hamburg. With a team of exceptional people, we want to empower everyday people to live a worry-free financial life. Even today, access to financial products is still complex and hence unevenly distributed, when in fact, it requires simple solutions to make them accessible to all. In November 2020 we went live with the rubarb app, offering a fully automated savings and investment platform for everyday people. Customers can make use of round-ups, savings plans and one-time payments in order to save money - free of barriers to entry and sustainable.  If you are passionate about solving relevant societal problems based on data and would like to work in an open and friendly multinational team with lots of development opportunities, this could be your next challenge. Here is your chance to create one of the most important business functions from scratch. You decide how.  Your responsibilities  You will be responsible for the overall area of data science, but especially for the development of machine learning algorithms You will define key metrics, take responsibility for business intelligence reports, and start searching an incredibly rich and diverse data set for patterns and validating hypotheses (or not) You'll work with AWS and for the large part have decision-making authority over which technologies to use, which you'll be responsible for deploying yourself You will select the tools needed to capture, store, and process ever-increasing amounts of data You will work with the tech team, reporting directly to the CTO and taking full responsibility for the data and related processes You will build and develop your own team You will work on longer term projects with more than twelve months of research time You understand the need to clean data before it is used and when security is paramount to protect the safety and identity of our customers Your profile  You have an academic background in a data science related field such as physics, biology, chemistry or mathematics You have relevant experience as a Data Scientist or Data Architect in a leading position You are proficient in all areas of building a data lake, from ETL processes to analysis and reporting to conceptualization and validation of hypotheses You are confident in programming in Python, Java or Go You are skilled in using R, Tableau, Microstrategy or similar and can argue when it is best to use what You have technical know-how in modeling and querying structured and unstructured data You have a good understanding of and experience with AWS You have very good English language skills, German is an advantage Finally, you have a sense of humor, a positive outlook on life, and love working on something meaningful with a team of many highly ambitious and intelligent people Why us?  You will have a positive impact on people’s lives by building a product that takes away their financial worries You will be part of an experienced, international and open-minded team with an ego-free culture We offer 30 vacation days and full flexibility to work in our office in the center of Hamburg or at home We regularly organize team events, offer free drinks (water, sodas, coffee, beer) and - of course - the obligatory foosball table Learning is very important for us, which is why you can use Wednesday afternoons to learn And if things get really wild, one of the founders even bakes a rhubarb crumble cake... To learn more about rubarb follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.  rubarb is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of race, national origin, color, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity age, marital status, disability, or age.

Associate Consultant Business Transformation (m/f/x) Introduction IBM Application Consultants work directly with our clients on key initiatives. You will have the opportunity to build an in-depth understanding of their business issues and implement organizational strategies that drive adoption of change. We are looking for experts who can build credibility and trust with our clients and provide knowledge that addresses individual and unique business needs.  Your Role and Responsibilities Designs and architects solutions to capture and manage data related to Client requirements for wireless communication and sensor equipment that comprises the Internet of Things (IoT). Strong understanding of IoT, protocols such as MQTT and platforms including IoTF / Bluemix, works with consultants to develop technical roadmap on IoT aligned to business goals, prepare solution architecture and models that can be handed over to delivery ad development teams for implementation. Strong Industry understanding and domain regarding IoT. Solutions may run on multiple IBM platforms and applications including PMQ, IOC, Internet of Things Platform, Real Time Insights, SDvP Next, Mobile First, TRIRIGA and Maximo components, as well as various Client applications and third-party cloud platforms. This role is responsible for the critical evaluation of technology, and leading the selection of development methodologies and tools for deployment.  body { margin: 0 0 0 0; padding:0 0 0 0 } td,div { font-family:IBM Plex Sans;font-size:10pt;vertical-align:top } /* Copyright IBM Corp. 2016 All Rights Reserved. */ body { margin: 0 0 0 0;
