Lead Engineer HiPeople Home Office We're here to make hiring easy, everywhere Through our reference platform we enable science & data-driven decisions and help to eliminate the subjectivity & biases that follow.  Tasks  Hi we're HiPeople!  Before we tell you about how awesome we are (and we’re not just saying that) let's get some basics out of the way:  First, we're based in Berlin but have teams in Dublin and London, we support fully remote work from either GMT or CET. This is our current Engineering set-up and it's been working well ‍ Second, you might have noticed we are a young tech company. Do we have everything sorted, defined and set? Not even close, but we're working on it, and that's where talent like you come in. Give us feedback, get consensus to fix what's broken, and yes lead, but more important be a part of the team. You might be remote but you're not an island! Lastly, we offer all the normal perks including employee equity, competitive salaries, cool office space, free weekly lunch, access to Calm & Headspace for your mental health, choice of laptop, team week every summer ...and I'm going to stop here but you can check out below for more details. Why do you want to be our Lead Engineer when you could go anywhere else?  We are human first! With just as strong emphasis on team health as system health. Our team comprises various levels of experience and you’ll be there to nurture their development in a way that’s meaningful to each person while balancing the needs of the team, oh yes, plus you’ll ensure we’re always steering towards our vision. It’s no small ask so remember we’re here to support but ultimately the decisions are yours. Vision for the future: We’ve got an amazing product that we truly believe will make hiring easier for everyone, everywhere. At the same time we’re far from the complete package we strive to be and need an experienced leader, ideally someone who’s grown a small tech team, while being hands-on. We’re a truly collaborative environment. Engineering touches all parts of the organisation, from science & data science to sales to people and product. Your impact will be significant, thus collaboration, trust, and open-mindedness will be key to your success. Autonomy & trust: Last but not least, lead tech and architectural decisions by listening and working through initiatives with your team but also by being hands-on. You and the team want to try-out something new to keep us cutting edge, great, we’ll get out of the way to make that happen. Requirements  Some specs you should know: ‍ ‍  Our team works with: Go, TypeScript, React, Redux, AWS Our team works on: building intuitive web applications and APIs using modern tech stacks You and the team: work across functions, i.e. design, product and science to estimate, plan and execute new features and improve existing functionality You work: to promote code quality, new technologies, and architectural design within the company You: ship code every day Sound like you?  You ideally have 7+ years of full stack development experience. You have 1+ years of hands on leadership and want to grow in this direction but still love contributing code. Then this role is perfect for you! You translate ideas to end-to-end delightful experiences. It would be amazing if you understood the HR/recruiting tech space. You think about systems and services and write high quality code. You can collaborate with other teams to come up with high-impact ways of quickly solving problems. You can break down tricky topics in writing and in person. You will help to build a company inclusive culture and shape our future. Benefits  ‍ ‍ Parent-friendly culture  Remote-friendly environment  ‍ ️ Educational budget  Competitive compensation  ‍ ️ Calm or Headspace memberships  Quality-driven environment  ‍ ️ Flexible hours and vacation  Weekly team lunches  Top-of-the-line equipment  Equity

Academic Staff for the Biopolymers Group The lab of Prof. Lieleg at the Technical University of Munich (Campus Garching) is looking for academic staff (f/m/d) to develop bioinspired, multifunctional cellulose surfaces. Your responsibilities:   In close cooperation with two other research groups (Prof. Zollfrank, TUM & Prof. Gorb, University Kiel) we here aim at creating structured surfaces made from cellulose arrays that possess tailored functionalities. For this purpose, we will draw inspiration from naturally occurring fibrous structures used by animals or plants that control friction and adhesion, and we will create and modify semi-artificial systems made from aligned cellulose fibers. Your task will be to conduct topographical analyses of natural and synthetic cellulose-based surfaces and to study their friction response as well as their adhesive properties. The project goal is to develop bio-inspired cellulosic surfaces for biomedical and/or technical applications. You will be mainly supervised by Prof. Dr. Lieleg (TUM School of Engineering and Design, Department of Materials Engineering) and you will mainly work in a small team of three researchers that tackle different tasks of this interdisciplinary project.   Your qualifications:  You have a very good Master’s degree in materials science, mechanical engineering, or from a related field. You are interested in investigating interdisciplinary scientific questions, and you can work well in a team. Experience with material characterization techniques (e.g., microscopy, rheology, tribology, adhesion tests) are necessary for this project. Very good English skills are required.   Our offer:  We offer a 75% position as academic staff with the opportunity to pursue a doctoral degree. The position will be limited to three years. Payment will be based on the Collective Agreement for the Civil Service of the Länder (TV-L). TUM strives to raise the proportion of women in its workforce and explicitly encourages applications from qualified women. Applications from disabled persons with essentially the same qualifications will be given preference.   Your application:  If you are interested in working in our team, please send your application together with a strong CV and supporting documentation (e.g., transcripts of records) to:   bme.mw@tum.de  All application documents should arrive no later than September 16th 2021. As part of your application, you provide personal data to the Technical University of Munich (TUM). Please view our privacy policy on collecting and processing personal data in the course of the application process pursuant to Art. 13 of the General Data Protection Regulation of the European Union (GDPR) at https://portal.mytum.de/kompass/datenschutz/Bewerbung/. By submitting your application, you confirm to have read and understood the data protection information provided by TUM. Find out more about Prof. Lieleg’s lab here:   https://www.mw.tum.de/en/bme/home/ Hinweis zum Datenschutz: Im Rahmen Ihrer Bewerbung um eine Stelle an der Technischen Universität München (TUM) übermitteln Sie personenbezogene Daten. Beachten Sie bitte hierzu unsere Datenschutzhinweise gemäß Art. 13 Datenschutz-Grundverordnung (DSGVO) zur Erhebung und Verarbeitung von personenbezogenen Daten im Rahmen Ihrer Bewerbung. Durch die Übermittlung Ihrer Bewerbung bestätigen Sie, dass Sie die Datenschutzhinweise der TUM zur Kenntnis genommen haben. Product Development (Engineering) teams to help keep our solutions the best in the industry  Present at or attend industry seminars and/or trade shows when required  You will become an expert in Email Security, Advanced Persistent Threats, Attack Protection, Threat Response, Data Loss Prevention (DLP), and the threat landscape What you bring to the team  Proven hands-on experience in a customer facing role, either as a Sales/Systems Engineer, Technical Account Manager, Security Engineer or senior level product support, preferably in the cyber-security industry  Proven experience in either secure messaging, data security, network security, endpoint, NOC/SOC or MSP-related cybersecurity  Track record developing and maintaining customer relationships with large (Enterprise) clients/organizations  Excellent communication skills and comfortable presenting to individuals and/or teams including technical staff and C-suite executives  You can work independently, adapt quickly and maintain a positive attitude  Fluency in German and English is required Exposure to at least two of the following skill sets are recommended:  Enterprise email solutions such as Exchange, G-Suite, Lotus Domino, O365 or working knowledge of SMTP  Email authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC)  Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) Protection  IT security, vulnerability or risk assessments, and policy enforcement  Data Loss Prevention (DLP), compliance and data privacy  Cloud security and shadow IT knowledge Nice to have  Degree in Computer Science preferred, but not required  CISSP or other industry certification is beneficial In addition to the above, if you have been a part of a sales team before or have a desire to take your career in that direction, as well as an enthusiasm for cyber-security and related security standards and frameworks like ISO, NIST and MITRE. If you love to stay on top of the fast-changing threat landscape and to help to educate and protect our customers and prospects. And if your experience is backed up by a strong knowledge of the underlying protocols such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, SMTP and others, we would love to speak to you! Why Proofpoint We are wholly devoted to helping our customers protect their greatest assets and biggest security risk: their people. That’s why we’re a pioneer in next-generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner. We welcome candidates from all walks of life. Apply today and explore your future #LifeAtPFPT. #LI-CB1 If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Junior Consultant Trainee (m/f/d) - TimeSeries / Mendix Siemens Industry Software GmbH Frankfurt am Main Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  About us: In the last couple of years, TimeSeries has been the most experienced and innovative low-code and Mendix partner and recently, we became part of the Mendix-Siemens organization. What differentiates us is the fact that we create industry specific templates. We apply innovative technologies like Big Data, IoT and AI to solve repeatable problems while at the same time being customizable to perfectly fit the clients’ business processes.  TimeSeries started in 2014 with the aim to bring innovative apps to the manufacturing industry, energy and marine. We created a big data platform that can process 7 billion(!) measurements a day, developed an automated planning tool that can solve the most complex planning issues in a matter of seconds and many more!  Since the start, we have been working closely with Mendix and they have already recognized us for years because of our innovative and industry specific solutions. Mendix-Siemens acquired TimeSeries to invest even more in this to help clients worldwide to innovate their business.  Our motto: “We are all entrepre-nerds and we put our customers' needs and relationships above all. We do that by outsmarting everyone with the best people, latest technologies and commitment to the limit. We innovate by experimenting and learning and we thrive in an open culture. Enjoy the ride!” - TimeSeries  We use the Mendix application development platform (aPaaS) to design, implement and roll out intelligent, innovative desktop/tablet/mobile solutions. We often combine Mendix with a range of cutting edge technologies like IoT and Blockchain. Where other companies still treat these as buzzwords and try to find out how to use them, we already built and delivered practical solutions with it, resulting not only in content clients all around the world, but also in winning hackathons like the Mendix World ISS Hackathon, World Port Hackathon and the UWV/SVB Hackathon! Starting as a trainee you will start with our 4 months fast-forward training program in which you will learn everything you need to know about the Mendix platform, consultancy, our smart solutions and the basics of other technologies that might come in handy like CSS, Java, Javascript, HTML, REST and SOAP. Once we think you’re ready you will start at one of our challenging projects at the customer side. You wil learn how to gather requirements and advise customers talking to people from the business and IT alike. Your magic with Mendix will turn complex business requirements into great, flexible apps in no-time! You will help our clients to perform better, work more efficiently and become future-proof!  What we’re looking for: You love to develop creative, innovative appsYou are a creative thinker and like to create beautiful applications that make the world run better. TimeSeries builds wonderful applications that enhance our customers’ business and put broad smiles on the faces of their users. We’ll make a great match! You have completed a Master’s or Bachelor’s degreePreferably IT related like Computer Science, Information Science, Artificial Intelligence, Business Information Management et cetera, but other backgrounds are most welcome too! Your brains!No, we’re not zombies. We’re looking for the best people on the market, those that want to learn, those brilliant minds that dare to experiment with technology! We constantly develop and improve ourselves, so we need you to be curious and wanting to learn. You have 0 to 2 years of professional working experience in IT or related fields of work. Preferably you already had your first introduction with Mendix.No Mendix experience yet? No problem, let’s work on it! You have basic knowledge of web technologies like HTML5, JavaScript and CSS3.You have a winner’s mentality and like to work within a team!  Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Industry Software GmbH Experience Level: Early Professional Job Type: Full-time

Senior Data Engineer Video Perception for Automated Driving Bosch Group 70565 Stuttgart Company Description  Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.  The Robert Bosch GmbH is looking forward to your application!  Job Description  Autonomous driving places the highest and most complex challenges on the algorithmic of the perception. Our future is therefore intrinsically tied to deep learning, data science and data engineering. Our foundation is a machine to build the machine. Are you ready to build this data engine with us and bring autonomous driving to the road? As a Senior Data Engineer, you are part of the agile team of video perception with focus on deep learning-based methods and data-driven development. Being DevOps minded, the team consists of deep learning, data and software engineers and specialists in algorithms and integration and testing. Together, you bring the “perception to the road”. You design, implement and test solutions for local as well as cluster- and cloud-based data pipelines for multitasking networks, feature heads or novel network architectures (e.g. sequence-based). You highly value efficiency especially in your field of connecting the team to the query engines of the Data Lake and the ELT-pipeline. You drive data engines further development and align with their developers as well as the community of other feature teams. Your goal is an optimized and highly automated integration into the data machinery for the ever newly upcoming challenges in the development, training and optimization of neural networks.  Qualifications Education: completed degree in Computer Science or a comparable degree program Personality and Working Practice: excellent communication skills, pragmatic, you like to take the initiative, assertive and enjoy working in a team, strong analytical skills combined with a very good ability to abstract, systematically, efficiently and independently Experience and Knowledge: several years of experience in the design and construction of very large and complex data infrastructures, in data lake and data pipeline technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop), containerization (e.g. Kubernetes, Docker) as well as in MLOps (e.g., Kubeflow, AzureML, SageMaker), already worked on very large projects, accordingly, you have exceptional skills in software development and with scripting languages (preferably Python), ideally, knowledge of computer vision, machine learning or deep learning. Languages: good knowledge of English in both spoken and written  Additional Information  Apply now in just 3 minutes! You want to work remotely or in part-time - we offer great possibilities for mobile working and different part-time models. Need support during your application? Miriam Steimmig (Human Resources) +49 711 811 27525 Need further information about the job? Jascha Freess (Functional Department) +49 711 811 37975 Jan Bernlöhr (Functional Department) +49 711 811 16048

(Senior) Data Engineer (m/f/d) What would be your mission?  Transform sustainability evaluation into data-driven challenges that enable companies to estimate and to offset their greenhouse gas emissions and save the world from the climate crisis! Abstract data sources from various industries into a data warehouse dedicated to calculate, compare and predict carbon footprints Work with other engineers and disciplines to come up with solutions to complex problems that are scalable, robust, reliable, and maintainable Evangelize a data-first approach within your cross-functional team of domain experts in the fast-paced world of a startup Who is our best match?  You are comfortable working with Python code and AWS, or better, you love them! You have a solid knowledge of database management concepts and a deep understanding of data modeling and warehousing, ETL concepts, and BI tools You have experience with DevOps essentials such as Docker, CI/CD, and Cloud infrastructures (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) You have some knowledge about Django or other backend web frameworks and the willingness to get your hands on them when the world needs you You had worked on data-centric products, provable by git repositories or your skills You favor action and ownership that you can demonstrate with your CV or cover letter You have a bachelors or masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related/relevant technical field or 2+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer or a similar position You can read, write, and speak professional English. We have a diverse international team and use English as our working language What do we offer?  Become part of something bigger! We join forces in creating the leading platform for carbon management to build a planet-positive economy and make our ambitious OKRs reality At Planetly you can do what you love and are best at, while doing good and create real world impact You will become part of a collaborative and cross-functional environment, supported by regular knowledge sharing sessions, where you will be empowered through ownership We are ever evolving and so are you. A formalized bi-annual feedback process, meeting ratings, pulse checks, and leadership coaching to make sure that we grow together and find everyone's perfect spot at the table. Enjoy the perks of working remote first but always feel free to join us in our office in the heart of Berlin including a beautiful garden and the option to bring your dog to work We offer an attractive & competitive salary, as well as the equipment of your choice (iOS/Windows, home office furniture) and coverage for your cost of commuting if necessary Let’s do good and have some fun! We are looking forward to hearing from you!  Please note that we are looking for the best talents who are eager to let Planetly grow. In this, we do not mind if you are based in Berlin, Germany, or anywhere else within the EU. Depending on your location, we offer the opportunity of full-time employment or contract to hire. If you are applying for this position, please make sure to fill in the relevant information when asked for.  At Planetly, we believe that diversity builds resilience. Therefore, we value all perspectives brought to the table within our team, while we are creating a planet-positive economy.  We seek to build an inclusive workplace that is psychologically and physically safe. Therefore we welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in the industry: people of color, LGBTQAI+ folks, women, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), people of any age, or family status. We encourage you to apply even if you do not fit 100% of the technical requirements.  We are here to focus on our strengths and work as a team to learn, grow, and build amazing things together. We at Planetly show zero tolerance to intolerance.

DATEV Level 3 Support EY Global Services Limited prod 10117 Berlin At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  Enterprise Technology provides reliable, secure and resilient technology services and solutions to support our 280,000 EY people. As part of Enterprise Technology, you’ll be at the forefront of enabling innovative technologies including emerging collaboration tools and top-tier technology infrastructure. Our aim is to create a superior customer experience with clear investment in innovation, alongside operational excellence that delivers efficient, quality services and solutions. You will work with technologists and business experts to meet the increasing pace of our business. That means more growth for you, exciting learning opportunities, career choices, and the chance to make a real impact.  The opportunity  Vacancy came about because the senior DATEV administrator will retire. Work with a small highly motivated and flexible Team. Take over responsibility, work with different teams, able to push projects and work independently.  Your key responsibilities  Re-creation, analysis, troubleshooting, and diagnosis of incidents relating to off-the-shelf and proprietary applications and/or platforms Determination of root cause of incidents (configuration vs. defect) Liaison with appropriate teams for the development of corrective actions or viable workarounds to resolve incidents Installation of applications in supported environments Deployment of application upgrades and fixes Responding to automated alerts on the health of systems Executing scheduled or unscheduled tasks relating to operational maintenance and monitoring of applications  Skills and attributes for success  Experience in installation and configuration of DATEV modules on a Citrix XenApp environment Knowledge of administration and troubleshooting of DATEV modules Knowledge of DATEV administration: including permissions, users/groups, methods, processes, etc. DATEV experience in supporting DATEV modules  To qualify for the role you must have  A degree in Computer Science/Management or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience At least 3 years of experience in Application Management, Operational Support environment/discipline Advanced troubleshooting of file and access issue Knowledge of root cause analysis of bugs and defects Basic server management and networking skills Ability to lead project activities and to coordinate other teams as needed Ability to work well within a multi-disciplinary team structure, but also independently Strong interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills Ability to meet agreed deadlines, with demonstrable productivity (Incident Completions etc.) English and German language skills - excellent written and verbal communication  Ideally, you’ll also have  Azure technologies Implementation of big scale applications Development knowledge DevOps Basic PowerShell Knowledge Basic Knowledge of Software Distribution Tools, preferably Ghost/Altiris  What we look for  Someone who can take care of the DATEV support, maintaining the relationship with the business and the different stake holders on the vendor side. Capable of dealing with incidents, changes, and service request for this complex application. Improving the current process and bringing new ideas to the team.  What we offer  We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:  Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.  The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Senior Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d) Aitaro GmbH München Aitaro is a young TUM tech startup with proven track record focused on data-driven innovation. At Aitaro we support other companies in the holistic development of data-driven innovation projects, products and services and simultaneously develop exciting products in this area ourselves. As a Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer at Aitaro you will work independently but in a team with the latest frameworks and technologies on exciting customer projects. At the same time, you have the opportunity to continuously develop our product and optimize the underlying algorithms. Due to our lean and agile company structure, you not only have a lot of responsibility, but also always have the opportunity to dive into other areas and activities and shape your own path.  Tasks  You self-sufficiently analyze, clean and prepare data You train state-of-the-art models on on-premise and cloud resources while interpreting their results to adjust your methods and pipelines You also work on the application(s) around the models and data as well, such as web backends and frontends or similar interfaces depending on the needs You provide your own ideas and thoughts to accelerate our data-driven innovation process You are an integral part of the Mario Kart round Requirements  Completed a Master of Science in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a comparable degree 3+ years work experience as a data scientist or machine learning engineer Profound technical knowledge in the field of data science Technical knowledge with the following programming languages and frameworks• Python, jupyter• Any of: Tensorflow / PyTorch / Keras or similar• scikit-learn The ability to work independently Communication skills to interact with clients and team members to discuss information and findings Bonus: Basic knowledge in the field of web development and cloud services such as AWS / Azure Initiative and motivation to learn new things German is a major plus Benefits  Exciting and innovative topics applying the latest tech stack Opportunity to shape the path of the company and grow yourself in the process A young highly motivated team with super smart people Freedom and responsibility combined with short decision-making paths A beautiful office in the heart of Munich (Marienplatz) Sounds interesting?  What are you waiting for then?! We are looking forward to getting to know you.

Data Engineer Allied Clinical Management GmbH Wuppertal We are looking for a Data Engineer (m/w/d) with experience in building data pipelines coded in Python (m/f/d) for an 18 month assignment for the location Wuppertal, NRW. 37.5 hours per week.  Latest start time: 01.January 2022 Aim of the project: Digital transformation of the site   Our client is a global leader in the pharmaceutical and crop protection industry with over 100,000 employees worldwide. Since 2006, Allied Clinical Management GmbH has been providing this company with its experts for short, medium and long-term project assignments. We guarantee first-class working conditions as well as very fair compensation. Major Tasks  You will typically be part of an agile project team to develop tailor-made digital tools hand-in-hand with our business function (production, quality, engineering) You will design and build python-based data pipelines and frontends to support data science projects following software engineering best practices and use state-of-the art technologies to acquire, ingest and transform big datasets You will map data fields to hypotheses, curate, wrangle and prepare data to be used in advanced analytics models or dashboards You will create and manage data environments in the cloud according to corporate standards  Requirements Several years hands-on experience in building data pipelines in production with proven ability to write clean, maintainable and robust code in Python (preferred), Scala, Java or similar languages in a professional setting Several years hands-on experience in building tailored frontends (UI/UX), e.g. Plotly/Dash Expertise in software engineering concepts and best practices and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data Exposure to DevOps, DataOps and MLOps would be considered a plus Very good knowledge of German and/or English Valid work permit for Germany at the time of applying   Benefits Attractive and above average salary Home Office/ On site: 50% / 50% 30 days paid vacation per year First-class contacts to renowned companies

Senior eDiscovery (f/m/d) EY 65760 Eschborn At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself and a better working world for us all. With our Assurance Services, we strengthen public confidence in global capital markets and promote sustainable growth. If you’re looking to develop your individual skills while working in interdisciplinary and multicultural teams, come and shape your career path with us! It’s yours to build!  What you can expect – enriching experiences that will last a lifetime As part of our Forensic & Integrity Services team in Mannheim or Frankfurt/Main, you will tackle corporate crime and protect the values and reputation of our national and international clients. Your key responsibilities Support our team in identifying information within large volumes of data (Big Data Analytics), development of ideas on structuring and, with the help of intelligent technology, filtering data Managing data backups and eDiscovery measures as well as coordinating communication with clients Enhancement of our data analysis methodology and processes Working with international teams Carrying out special investigations, using appropriate search strategies and algorithms to analyze mass data  What you can contribute – skills for shaping the future Minimum of three years’ experience of working with common eDiscovery and forensic software products (preferably NUIX or Relativity by kCura) as well as a sound basic knowledge of various operating systems, database technologies and networks A degree in a science-related field (e.g., computer science, mathematics or business information technology) Experience in programming languages, MS SQL, script languages (e.g., Ruby, ECMA Script or Python) or computer security  What make you stands out – attributes of your success Proactive and solution-oriented approach to the needs and expectations of clients as well as team goals Very good spoken and written command of English and German  What we can offering – an inspiring work environment Exciting areas of responsibility at various clients, agile working methods and scope to put innovative ideas into practice First-class development and career advancement opportunities Diversity and equal opportunities as well as an open corporate culture  Find out more here about the many benefits to which you are entitled as employee at EY.  Become part of our high-performing teams! Apply online via our job portal: www.de.ey.com. If you have any questions, please contact our Recruitment Center at: +49 6196 996 10005. You want to learn more about the application process at EY? Get more information on our EY website or on kununu and Glassdoor.

Senior Networking Specialist (f/m/w) Introduction At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities  #TSSDACH In this job the Senior Networking Specialist will provide remote technical support to IBM Enterprise customers by troubleshooting and resolving software and hardware issues related to Networking environment.  The products supported are primarily Cisco and other industry leading vendors like Juniper, Adva, F5, Fortinet where IBM has business alliances. This Job requires strong knowledge and experience on associated technologies (Routing, switching, DC, and Security) with relevant certification required by the Vendors. As Senior Networking Specialist, your missions are to address the technical problems of IBM customers, to perform failure analysis, to provide technical solution and root cause, aline other technical roles to a common goal of effective solution, support filed technicians and document the stages of problem resolution in IBM call management system. Senior Networking Specialist in this job role will support products or solutions based on any vendors hardware including software operating system. Senior Networking Specialists as part of Technical Support have responsibility for troubleshooting, and to manage customer situations.  This includes the following activities: Analysis of incidents with information and log provided by customers Assistance to the analysis for the installation, configuration or use Analysis of diagnostic information to isolate the causes of the problem. Identify known defects and sources of the problem to solve problems. Provide action plan for correction or a work around to restore the service Provide assistance on matters relating to the products supported in the contract. Participate in standby rotation to ensure 24/7 coverage Ensure customer relationship and communication, monitoring records and ensure escalation to the next level of support or to the vendor when a solution is not found within the time limit. Ensure the ownership of the incident management from start to end and transfer of the information to a  backup  in case of leave. Ensure autonomy in education for new products, version, etc. This support activity requires an ability to work in a team and good technical skills It requires the certification of products in the domain of competency  #GTSBGHR21  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Technical expertise in Network platforms Cisco, Juniper or Adva with some Security knowledge Good knowledge in Network Infrastructure Demonstrated experience in this area Ability to understand complex technical environments Autonomy, reliability, dependability Ability to communicate with Clients Administrative discipline and organization of work Good level of use of MS Office tools German language fluent in speaking and writing English and German language fluent in speaking and writing Cisco CCNA certification Juniper JNCIA certification  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience of minimum 3 years in Networking with proven ability for Client’s support is preferred Experience in working with Avaya infrastructure It is an advantage to have the CISCO CCNP or CCIE Certification level on one or more specialization below: Borderless Networks Architecture specialization (Routing & Switching) Security Collaboration Architecture (Voice) Data Center Architecture (Nexus, SDN) It is an advantage to have the Juniper JNCIP or JNCIE Certification level on or more specialization below: Juniper Enterprise (JNCIA-ENT or JNCIS-ENT) Juniper Security (JNCIA-SEC or JNCIS-SEC) Juniper SDN  About Business UnitAt Global Technology Services (GTS), we help our clients envision the future by offering end-to-end IT and technology support services, supported by an unmatched global delivery network. It's a unique blend of bold new ideas and client-first thinking. If you can restlessly reinvent yourself and solve problems in new ways, work on both technology and business projects, and ask,  What else is possible?  GTS is the place for you!  Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  Location StatementIBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.  Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

document: Clinical Data Scientist TeamViewer GmbH München Company Description PSI is a leading Contract Research Organization with more than 25 years in the industry, offering a perfect balance between stability and innovation to both clients and employees. We focus on delivering quality and on-time services across a variety of therapeutic indications. Job Description Reporting to the Associate Director Risk-Based and Centralized Monitoring, the Clinical Data Scientist is an integral part of our team here at PSI. You will work with clinical trials patient and operational data, develop new data solutions and set up Risk-based Monitoring systems in Process Improvement department. Based in Munich Project/ program assignments Participate in selection of the Risk-Based Monitoring (RBM) system and provide relevant training to the project team and/or Sponsor Set up and maintain RBM systems in collaboration with Central Monitoring Manager Establish data extract, load and transformation process for a study. Manage large complex datasets (including unstructured data) coming from multiple data sources. Map, mine and classify raw data and pull processed data into PSI data platform Program and produce data listings, tables and figures for Clinical Data Reviewers and Central Monitoring Managers Calculate Key Risk Indicators and Quality Tolerance Limits. Apply advanced analytical technics to identify data trends and patterns for Centralized Monitoring Collaborate with Central Monitoring Manger and cross-functionally to identify study challenges, develop an action plan and data solutions to address those using advanced analytics technics. Provide outputs actionable for project team Communicate and explain data findings and solutions to cross-functional stakeholders Corporate/ departmental assignments Participate in development and programming of databases and software products for Centralized Monitoring Participate in development of processes, Quality System Documents (QSDs) and internal instructions for Centralized Monitoring Qualifications A degree in a Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or equivalent or Data Science related work experience and professional qualifications At least 3-year experience or equivalent in Data Management, Biostatistics, and Centralized Monitoring At least 2-year experience with one or more of the following: R, Shiny, Python, Jupyter, SAS, SQL, Spark and associated packages and libraries (advanced knowledge of R-packages, RStudio, SAS and Excel is an advantage) At least 2-year experience in data management area including one or more of the following: relationship databases, data warehousing, data schemas, data stores, data modeling, testing, validation and analysis Knowledge of ELT/ETL process is a plus Experience with databases engineering and development is a plus Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques for analyzing data is a plus Experience with using Machine Learning technics is a plus Experience with Shiny development is a plus Experience with products testing and validation is a plus Strong analytical and logical thinking, focus on results Communication and collaboration skills Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team English skills (Advanced) Additional Information Make the right call and take your career to a whole new level. Join the company that focuses on its people and invests in their professional development and success.

Head of Production Process, Clay Braas GmbH Oberursel Posted 20 August, 2021 Head of Production Process, Clay BMI Group BMI - G - DE - Oberursel Full time Empower, Connect, Evolve, and Inspire - these are the values that drive us and make BMI a company where you can thrive and grow. Head of Production Process, Clay The role: BMI are looking for a Head of Production Process, Clay to deliver most efficient/effective production and reduce complexity. You will be responsible for solving complex problems in the production process. Your tasks include building winning teams and improving the quality of our products. You will be actively reacting to internal and external changes with focus on energy efficiency and value adding activities. Furthermore you will foster systemic and automated data intelligence thinking as a drive of continuous improvement. The position contains frequent international business trips and work at different BMI locations within Europe. You could be based at one of our production sites in Germany, e.g. Heusenstamm, Werne, Bamberg, Saarwellingen, or in the Netherlands, Groningen, and/or work partially from home. Key responsibilities: Production process knowledge management (documentation & trainings & people knowledge sharing) within BMI Central management of best & bad practices (materials, recipes, production equipment and processes, ranges of products, capacities, locations) keep updated the BMI Clay Network, organize and steer international best practices meetings within BMI Promote and lead process improvement initiatives: Application of new production process technologies Implement controls systems & support shop floor control projects Lead projects to improve Quality, OEE and Costs through a lower consumption (energy, raw materials, labour), and environmental footprint reduction (CO2, scrap, waste, etc). Actively participate in solving complex problems in the production process Collaboration within BMI TC, E2E SC, Quality, HSE Keep up to date with new process automatisation (also out of our businesses) applicable to our industry (digitalization, automation) Qualifications: university degree (B.Sc./M.Sc.) in computer science, electrical engineering, process engineering, mechanical engineering, materials engineering, ceramic engineering, mining engineering Fluent English (add. Professorship in Data Science About XU  The XU Exponential University of Applied Sciences is a private, state-accredited university of applied sciences in Potsdam, Brandenburg. XU's offerings are consistently geared towards the digital transformation, the start-up fast-growing digital entrepreneurial innovation and the new competencies and skills for the jobs of the future.  XU's goal is to enable students, entrepreneurs, employees and managers to grow in the digital age and actively shape the digital transformation. We are looking for professors (m/f/d) for our study programs who represent digitalization topics, who hold entrepreneurial, innovative and international mindset in teaching and research and who are enthusiastic about building a new university of applied sciences focused on Industrial Revolution 4.0 challenges.  As we are growing exponentially, we are looking for enthusiastic candidates (m/f/d) to join our team as soon as possible in the role of Professor (m/f/d) for Data Science. Applications for this new post are invited from outstanding candidates in the field of data science, with a focus on its computational, machine learning, or computational statistics aspects.  Tasks  Teaching courses of data science, mathematics, statistics, computing and machine learning, artificial intelligence, programming, and related topics, in our (current) Data Science, Digital Business, Digital Marketing, Coding and Software Engineering bachelor and (planned) Digital Transformation master programs (in addition, teaching courses in the field of software engineering and IT related topics, though not a mandatory requirement is considered a plus). Supervising examinations, internships, projects, bachelor and master theses. Participating in the further development, consultation and organization of new courses. Planning and implementation of research and development projects, including publishing activities and other initiatives as adequate. Establishing a network with partner companies and supporting internships and collaborative projects. Participating in the academic self-administration of the university. Self-identification with the innovative teaching approach of the XU Exponential University. Commitment to contribute to the teaching experience with an interdisciplinary approach, as well as with practical experience in a digitally growing world. Experience with start-ups as well as with the associated environment are desirable. Commitment to engage and develop further the XU innovative and interactive didactic concepts and methods. Commitment to participation in interdisciplinary courses as well as in the implementation of English-language courses. Requirements  Completed doctoral or PhD studies in the field of Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other related subject area. Pedagogic and didactic experience for academic teaching in English. Practical professional experience of data science with a focus on computational machine learning, programming, or computational statistics of at least 5 years (preferably after completing the PhD) are considered a plus. Research track record in thesoftware engineering field proven by consultancy projects and/or publications in international scientific conferences and journals, etc. Additional experience in the acquisition, execution and management of research projects is a plus. Knowledge and experience of undertaking research on data science methodology, with a focus on computational machine learning, programming, or computational statistics aspects. Experience with at least some of the latest trends in data science, including AI explainability/interpretability, data science ecosystem, python and other fastest-growing major programming languages, automated machine learning (AutoML) tools, natural language processing (NLP), cloud-based big data science and graph databases. It is expected that the future holder of the position will shift his/her center of life to Berlin/Potsdam area (on-site presence). Very good communication skills and teamwork, ability to interact and motivate students and other key stakeholders. Fulfill the official requirement captured by § 41 of State of Brandenburg (Brandenburgisches Hochschulgesetz (BbgHG)). Which other criteria are important?  Relevant teaching experience in data science. Additional teaching in the field of software engineering and IT related topics, though is not mandatory, is considered a plus. Relevant experience in the supervision of scientific work of students, such as bachelor and master theses is desirable. Broad professional practical experience (with leadership responsibility) in the field of the appointment, for example in tech start-ups, tech companies, industry and/or in consulting related to data science, complete your profile. Core values and social commitment to XU community and beyond matter, of course, for us. In addition, we would like to see your enthusiasm and active involvement in building a new university and interest in producing an impact beyond. Teaching experience in German, though not mandatory is considered a plus. International experience, both industrial and academic. Entrepreneurial mindset. Benefits  Excellent working conditions in an attractive modern environment. The opportunity to impact on a young university. The chance to set your own focus in research, as well as in new courses of study and, in the future, new subject areas, etc. Friendly atmosphere, teamwork-oriented and committed colleagues who love what they do. The opportunity to build and develop processes that ensure high-quality teaching and innovative research in the long term. Sounds interesting?  Then we look forward to receiving your complete digital application. Please submit your documents via email only. Applications are currently being considered.  Application  Please, include the following information in your application and submit your application in a single PDF file.  Cover letter explaining your motivation to join XU. Detailed resume and list of publications. Doctoral certificate University certificates An overview of the courses and projects you have held so far (scope, subject) Relevant experience certificates. Teaching experience including evaluation forms (if available). Teaching statement describing potential courses to cover. Research statement describing your research vision.

Research Activities Responding to intelligence requests; managing and performing primary research activities to provide robust and accurate intelligence on a timely basis Developing primary research ideas, conducting in-depth primary research, gathering quantitative and qualitative information, and evaluating research findings to respond to research questions Bringing innovative methods to conduct primary research to ensure that primary elicitation activities deliver excellent results in a time- and cost-efficient manner Consistently developing and recommending reasonable, data-driven business-enhancing ideas and using market insights to inform business improvement decisions  Team Management Overseeing a primary research team and providing direction to the research and data-gathering activities of the team Providing leadership for primary research efforts, and developing and deploying innovative primary research techniques that reflect best practices in order to gather key strategic information and deliver robust intelligence Supporting continuous improvement within the PRC in collaboration with key stakeholders Maintaining the highest expertise in each protocol for compliance, standard operating procedures and applicable guidelines and regulations Managing and mentoring a highly dedicated and learned team of professionals  In addition, your role may also require: Conference Coverage: Attending key conferences with the objective of speaking to a wide range of delegates on predetermined topics and covering key symposia, presentations, posters and booths  Required Experience and Skills An undergraduate degree Fluency in English to the level of conducting research and performing interviews with clarity and full comprehension Five to seven years’ professional experience (including in internships or freelance assignments) in carrying out primary elicitation, ideally working as part of a business intelligence team in the pharmaceutical and biotech domain or within a pharmaceutical consulting environment At least two years’ experience line managing a team of primary researchers The confidence and competence to build rapport quickly with respondents and the flexibility to think quickly and adapt your style where required during interviews The motivation and resilience to make a high volume of outbound calls daily as well as experience working successfully to deadlines Proven ability to lead, manage and motivate others in a complex, multi-functional, multi-national matrix environment Excellent listening and conversational skills A natural curiosity and interest in problem solving  Desired Experience and Skills Fluency in additional languages beyond English A background in a people-based role such as sales, translation, market research (including cold calling) and/or journalism Prior exposure to pharmaceutical/biotech organisations, academia or consultancy/market research is helpful but not a requirement  What We Offer Competitive package and remuneration linked to performance Onboarding training and ongoing mentoring Flexible working opportunities once probation period is completed Opportunity to support pharmaceutical and biotech client accounts through tough business problems related to their portfolios, assets and brand strategies High-growth, entrepreneurial environment where you can work in high-performing teams yet still forge your own path  About Prescient Healthcare Group At Prescient, science is at the core of everything we do. We are a biopharma product and portfolio strategy partner that specialises in turning the science of molecules into optimal patient outcomes and client value. Across therapeutic areas, we help develop winning strategies. When companies partner with us, a molecule in their hands has greater potential for success than the same science in the hands of their competitors.  Founded in 2007, Prescient is a partner with global reach and recognised capabilities, with six offices across three continents. Our team of more than 150 experts works with 22 of the top 25 biopharmaceutical companies, the fastest-growing mid-caps and cutting-edge emerging biotechs, including some of the biggest and most innovative brands. More than 80% of our employees hold advanced degrees, and our teams deliver an impressive depth of therapeutic, clinical and commercial expertise, a wealth of relevant experience and knowledge of best practices and common pitfalls.  Prescient has been a portfolio company of Baird Capital since 2017 and Bridgepoint Development Capital since 2021. For more information, please visit: www.prescienthg.com. Senior Statistician Company Description  We are the company that cares – for our staff, for our clients, for our partners and for the quality of the work we do. A dynamic, global company founded in 1995, we bring together more than 2,000 driven, dedicated and passionate individuals. We work on the frontline of medical science, changing lives, and bringing new medicines to those who need them.  Job Description  Senior Statistician is an integral part of our team here at PSI. If you have experience in clinical research, understand SAS programming principles and concepts, and have a good knowledge of statistical methods, apply today! Office-based or Home-based You will: Lead all biostatistics activities related to clinical trials as responsible project statistician Communicate with project teams, clients and vendors on statistical questions Develop and review statistical sections of protocols, including sample size calculations Develop statistical analysis plans Develop and document analysis database structures (i.e. SAS analysis data set structures) Develop SAS program requirements and specifications SAS programming and program validation Review and QC of statistical deliverables (tables, listings, figures, etc.) Perform statistical analysis and report results Consult on experimental design, statistical methods and approaches for the purpose of assessing safety and efficacy of drug products Liaise with DM on statistical questions related to data issues, including coordination of data transfers from DM to Statistics Participate in bid defense meetings and kick-off meetings Train statisticians and SAS programmers Prepare and deliver presentations at investigators' meetings Address audits findings/recommendations, and follow-up on and resolution of audit findings Participate in the development of guidelines, procedures  Qualifications MSc in Statistics or equivalent Expert knowledge and understanding of the statistical principles, concepts, methods, and standards used in clinical research Knowledge and understanding of the SAS programming language; advanced knowledge of SAS software Ability to apply a range of advanced statistical techniques in support of clinical research studies and to analyze, interpret, and draw conclusions from complex statistical information Ability to consult with clinical investigators, interpret research requirements, and determine statistical analysis strategies Strong knowledge of CDISC ADaM IG 1.0 or later, define 1-0-0.xml and define 2-0-0.xml specifications Knowledge of relevant regulations and guidelines (e.g. FDA, EMA, ICH) Presentation and communication skills  Additional Information  Our mission is to be the best CRO in the world as measured by our employees, clients, sites, and vendors. Our recruitment process is easy and straightforward, and we’ll be there with you every step of the way. Having recently been awarded five CRO Leadership Awards in 2021, this is a great time to be joining a well-respected, Global company. Please submit your CV in English.

Abteilungsleitung Digital - Recycling Why TOMRA? Why TOMRA? TOMRA Sorting Solutions is a world leader in optical and electronic sorting equipment. TOMRA Sorting Solutions is a dynamic company with an outstanding product line and an excellent level of customer satisfaction. Why is it worthwhile to start and stay at TOMRA? Quite simply, we are a steadily growing international company that has retained its family atmosphere. Our corporate culture is Norwegian, which means there is no hierarchical thinking. If you are interested in titles and hierarchy you are at the wrong place here. We see a bright future in economic terms. Aside from that, it´s nice to know that our recycling machines are helping to make the world cleaner. Today, we are not utilizing resources in a sustainable way. In fact, the world is only 9% circular, meaning much of the Earth’s precious resources are only used once, leaving huge untapped potential for more sustainable resource management. TOMRA provides cutting-edge solutions for optimal resource productivity within the recycling, mining and food industries and is therefore uniquely positioned to shape the Circular Economy, creating demand for this way of thinking in the world. At TOMRA we want to be a thought leader, encouraging a more sustainable way of thinking and inspiring active change around the world. www.tomra.com The Position The Head of Digital Recycling is leading the cross-functional team implementing, adapting, and delivering the digital solutions in the Recycling Business Stream. These solutions are developed in close collaboration with the TS Digital Core team at TOMRA, who is responsible for the customer portal TOMRA Insight, and the development and operation of the underlying IoT infrastructure (edge to cloud). The cross-functional digital team in Recycling will focus on the extraction, connection, analysis of the data and the respective data quality, as well as the derived actions in service and sales support to bring the digital solutions to the market. The Head of Digital Recycling will be responsible – together with his team – to deliver on the digital strategy put forth in the Recycling Business Stream. To achieve this the Head of Digital Recycling as well as the digital team needs to be closely linked to the different functional areas within the Recycling Business Stream Product Management Recycling R&D Service Sales As well as the respective shared functions and other Business Divisions Core R&D, Deep Learning TS Digital Circular Economy Candidate Profile Master’s degree in Science, Engineering or equivalent preferred combined with a business background or MBA – alternatively 5 years of work experience in a similar role. Exposure to SaaS or PaaS, cloud-based solutions and services, software development, and Internet of Things, ideally in an industrial B2B environment. At ease in multinational, multi-cultural companies. Able to adapt style to the person in front in order to optimize communication efficiency. Self-motivated and having the proven capacity to fully complete tasks. Decide thoughtfully but quickly. Exposure to Azure or AWS is a plus. At ease with modern IT architectural framework and methodologies such as micro services, Dockers, scrum and DevOps. Handle stress and work under pressure. Flexibility to work outside standard office hours due to team members located in New Zealand, Europe, US, and China. Willingness to travel internationally (<33%). Are you interested? Please send a motivation letter (explaining why you are a good match for this position) to the attention of Mr. Parcker. Aside from this, we would need a CV in English Certificates from university, trainings, etc.

You can decide to specialize in Data Science, Data Engineering or Analytics Engineering, but you will get your hands dirty with all things Data: From logging, ingestion and ETLing to modeling, discovering insights and visualizing the results to business stakeholders! The key objective of your internship is to see how a high-growth startup works, learn, grow, and get a return offer to join the team as soon as you graduate! We currently have openings in three teams: Growth Drive budget efficiency in our user acquisition Help improve the onboarding experience of our users Support strategic initiatives of our Business development team Engagement Help organize the financial information in a format digestible to our users Use machine learning to improve our customer experience Help Product teams make data-driven decisions Data platform Work alongside Data/Machine Learning/Site reliability engineers Provision, deploy and scale infrastructure and systems Improve our data ingestion and visualisation capabilities    WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING Work closely with your mentor Participate in sprints, standups and modern software development processes Apply your academic background to real-world problems Learn, grow and have a ton of fun in the process!    WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR Enrolled in your last year before the end of your graduate or postgraduate program Exceptional communication skills in English Fluency in SQL paired with at least one of the following (Python or R) Growth mindset and positive attitude   WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY NOW  At Trade Republic you will get to do the best work of your career. We are a destination for people who are exceptional at what they do. Every day, we strive to build a world-class team and provide the space for people to do their best. We have a relentless ambition of raising the bar and expect the best from ourselves. Through our dedicated people-first management approach and transparent career paths, you will have the opportunity to develop and grow your career like never before. And because you are surrounded by a diverse team of high performers, you will be learning every day.  You will play an important role in fixing one of the largest challenges we face - closing the pension gap and democratizing wealth. Trade Republic is a place where your job, your career and your passions intersect. If this gets you fired up, just like it does for all of us at Trade Republic, then reach out! Trade Republic embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Data Visualization Engineer TrailStone Group Berlin About Trailstone Trailstone is a global energy and technology company, operating at the intersection of renewable and conventional power. We trade energy in global markets, and we provide a best-in-class service to manage the inherent intermittency of renewable power generation across the short, medium and long term. As an energy trader, we buy and sell electricity and gas which is physically delivered on the grids, and we leverage our physical market knowledge to trade financial commodities. As a provider of renewable energy management services, we take on the complexity of managing renewable power across different countries so that our customers can focus on their core mission of investment and growth. Trailstone offers an efficient, fully automated front-to-back renewable power management platform underpinned by our long-standing market experience, proprietary technology, data analytics and meteorology.  Role Profile As a Data Visualization Developer, you will develop interactive visualizations of Trailstone's financial, meteorological and infrastructure data to enhance our Renewable Energy and Trading platforms. You will work closely with business and technical groups to understand their visualization needs, and you will develop and integrate solutions with Trailstone's technology platform. You will co-ordinate with other technology team members to ensure best practices are followed in Trailstone's data presentation.  What will you do? Work with development, research, and business teams to present data for technical and non-technical users. Develop and refine data visualizations in both proprietary applications as well as commercial or opensource visualization and reporting tools. Translate complex data and analytics into a human readable visual format for rapid business decision making. Integrate and transform data from SQL and other sources to ensure consistent and accurate display of Trailstone's data.  Technical Requirements Substantive working experience developing and implementing performant, scalable, and secure data visualization and business intelligence tools. Experience developing dashboards in Tableau or Grafana. Experience with open source data visualization technologies and frameworks such as Apache Superset, Plotly, Python, or R. Experienced in manipulating SQL data for visual presentation and for use with applications and analytic processes. Proficient in programming with Python or C#. A Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, mathematics, or a related field. Demonstrable experience working with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Presto) is desirable but not required. Knowledge and experience with data science and machine learning analyses is desirable but not required. Knowledge and experience with web development is desirable but not required.  Additional Skills Outstanding written, verbal, and presentation skills, with the ability to develop and present conclusions and recommendation to senior executives. Ability to manage multiple projects with independent deadlines. Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary, global team. Fluent English language skills.  We're different, and we like it that way! Here at Trailstone, we value our differences. In fact, our success depends upon them. Differences in backgrounds, identities and experiences lead to differing views of the world. Different world views lead to healthy differences in opinions. Different opinions are essential to creating a robust marketplace of ideas. And it is our ideas that will make Trailstone a market leader in energy innovation and disruption! By our commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, Trailstone is creating value for our employees, our investors, and our communities. So regardless of your gender, race, ethnicity, orientation, physical limitations, how you identify, how you pray, who you love, where you went to school, who you consider family, or how old you are… you can belong here!

Data Scientist (m/f/x) At CLARK we believe that people deserve peace of mind. With that vision in mind, we set out on our mission. CLARK makes it easy to get properly insured. We created an app that makes it easier, simpler, and faster for consumers to manage their insurances - all in one central place where changes can be implemented with just a few clicks. Our secret sauce is to combine a best-in-industry user experience with honest and independent advice from insurance experts.  Since our founding in 2015, we have served almost half a million satisfied customers. Without our CLARKees, we could not have achieved our mission. We are extremely proud of our over 300 employees from over 40 nations, working from our offices in Berlin, Frankfurt, Püttlingen and Vienna. Fresh off our successful €69m in Series C funding backed by Top-Tier investors (Tencent and White Star capital among others) we want you to join us to be part of our successful journey.  We are looking for an experienced professional to accelerate our data science initiatives. This is an excellent opportunity to have an immediate impact on a fast-growing tech company. We are building an advanced self-serve Data Platform that empowers Data Scientists to own the entire lifecycle of data science projects.  What you will be doing  Growing revenue, engagement, and optimizing operations by building ML models Owning the entire lifecycle of Data Science projects: Value and feasibility assessments Exploratory Data Analysis Productionisation Monitoring and maintenance Collaborating with Data Analysts to support teams across the company using data science techniques Collaborating with Data Engineers to guide the evolution of our Data Platform Who you are  You are pragmatic & driven by impact. While you’re knowledgeable on modern ML models and techniques, you don’t use a NN where a naive Bayes would do. An analytical thinker with exceptional conceptual skills, and the ability to make your evaluations transparent, not only to your team but also to non-technical audiences. A curious individual, eager to learn about the processes and teams that are impacted by your ML models. A good communicator. You feel confident and comfortable when explaining complex concepts to your audience in English. German is a plus! What you ideally have  You have a Masters degree or a PhD in computer science, Mathematics, Economics, or other quantitative fields. You have at least 3 years of experience in building machine learning models in production, including their deployment, evaluation and monitoring to ensure they have a real impact. You are proficient in the use of SQL, git, and common data science tooling. Knowledge of dbt, Redshift, AWS SageMaker, and the Python DS toolkit (scikit-learn, pandas, etc.) is a plus. Experience in software development and best practices in a development team (e.g testing, CI/CD Code reviews) rounds up your profile. Why CLARK?  we encourage and support your proactive initiatives, strong contributions and relevant ideas we support you if a relocation is necessary want to inspire and share knowledge? We have you covered with our weekly Tech Brown Bag speech //tech only we offer German language courses - both beginner and advanced you get free drinks, fresh fruit and fantastic coffee you get mobile working options including flexible working hours you participate in culture initiatives e.g. team events, monday morning check-ins and with receding pandemic threat, hopefully soon, our monthly team lunch & breakfast, friday events and much more

Global Quality Assurance Manager (all genders) - limited to 2 years - part-time possible Merck KGaA Darmstadt Germany 64293 Darmstadt A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 58,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in Healthcare, Life Science and Electronics. Experience in working in international project management environment and to steer virtual teams Ability to establish collaborative relationships with various departments to deliver on quality commitments. Ability to work autonomously, effectively manage time and deliver results on time. Strong problem-solving skills Strong computer skills, including CSV e-quality systems   What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life! Software Development Product Owner - Framework Snke OS München Company Description  Snke OS™ is a universally deployable digital B2B platform, founded in 2020 & headquartered in Munich. Emerging technologies continue to drive a digital transformation in the healthcare economy. Our founders recognized the potential for value creation by decoupling & deploying their best-in-class platform & team so that other companies can scale up & innovate efficiently. Fueled by AI & big data analytics, Snke OS delivers the platform & infrastructure that enables partners across the healthcare industry to deploy digital solutions for safer & more efficient interventions.  The 150-person Snke OS team brings a wealth of experience to the new company with backgrounds in large platforms, digital health & software-driven medical technology. Let’s impact the industry together! We are looking for pioneers to lead fast & lead first with Snke OS.  Job Description  Snke OS is developing and maintaining a large software framework that is used to develop Snke OS applications and services. It provides functionality for different areas like base libraries delivering the fundamentals, medical data libraries delivering functionality related to DICOM and FHIR, algorithmic libraries as well as an application framework. Major parts of the framework are written in C++, but some parts are also written in other languages such as C# and JavaScript. As a Product Owner framework you will: Actively perform requirements engineering with the users of the framework in order to gather feature requests Consolidate and prioritize the collected feature requests and align with strategic goals as well as ongoing product development Closely work together with software architects ensuring that feature requests are aligned with the strategic software architecture Plan and schedule releases together with stakeholders as well as with the framework development teams Plan and execute sprints together with the development teams in order to deliver valuable features on time  Qualifications A degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent working experience Strong software engineering background – ideally, you actively developed software for at least 5 years Strong communication skills in English and German Experience as a Product Owner or in project management with a variety of stakeholders – ideally, you are a certified Product Owner Experience in working with Azure DevOps, Jira, or similar tools Ideally, you have experience with programming languages like C++, C# and Java Script and know some state-of-the-art web technologies like HTTP, REST, JSON, OAuth Additionally, you know what services and micro-services are and cyber security is something you understand A deeply analytical mindset Well-organized and clearly structured, agile working style  Additional Information International team of supportive colleagues Centrally located, modern work spaces 30 days of vacation plus 24.12. and 31.12.
