Biostatistician (m/f/d) Frankfurt 65.000 - 75.000 Join a growing Biostatistics research team in Frankfurt! This is an opportunity to work on advanced analytics projects that improve current solutions and establish new ones. If you want to work in a dynamic work environment with a wide variety of projects, this Biostatistician role will allow you to utilise your skillset. THE COMPANY You will join a new team that is going to grow in the next few months. Parallel teams in other areas will give you the opportunity to share best practices and insights. The company actively encourages national and international knowledge sharing. You are going to collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders and are expected to embrace the culture of continuous learning in the company. THE ROLE As Biostatistician in this team, you will be working on large, diverse data sets alongside your colleagues. Through your statistical analysis and input you will drive product development and strategy. Collaboration with internal and external partners is necessary to establish standards and guidelines for data collection. You will take on mentor responsibilities for new colleagues that join in the next few months. Additionally, you will support the digital transformation of the company and represent biostatistics in meetings and cross-functional projects. YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Masters degree in Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Physics Relevant experience in research projects through various phases Highly analytical thinking and very good knowledge of statistical methods Experienced working with SAS, Python or R Ability to work in interdisciplinary teams and a fast-paced environment Excellent communication skills and collaborative approach to teamwork THE BENEFITS Competitive Salary + Benefits Joining a growing team with leadership and mentor opportunities A company culture that encourages personal and professional growth Work-life balance with the possibility to have flexible work hour arrangements Engaged colleagues that love to work on innovative projects HOW TO APPLY Please register your interest by applying through this page or get in touch with Judith to ask further questions.

Background in any of the following: Data Warehousing, Big Data, Hadoop ecosystems, Business Intelligence, Streaming applications, Data Lakes, Data Migration or or large scale operational Analytics Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating Analytics - either on premises or in the cloud Knowledge of some relevant languages, tools and frameworks (e.g python, Java, R, scala, spark, Kafka, Hadoop ecosystem, presto, Hive,Teradata, Elasticsearch and SAS Analytics amongst others) Experience engaging successfully with internal or external stakeholders delivering solutions to help businesses suceed Are you an Analytics, Big Data or Data Warehousing specialist? Do you have experience of data ingestion, storage, processing and visualization? Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new data analytics technologies? Come join us! As a Specialist Solutions Architect, you will innovate and scale architectural best practices around building and operating Analytics workloads by collaborating with key customers, developing content and enabling the wider community to adopt the AWS portfolio of services around Analytics. In this role, you will have the opportunity to enhance your knowledge around high-volume, large scale analytics, help shape AWS services and leverage this expertise to guide AWS customers in multiple sectors across EMEA As a trusted advisor with technical expertise in Analytics, you will share recommendations around security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate key projects for our customers. Inside AWS, you are an ambassador of our customers. You will articulate customer needs by synthesizing your observations from customer engagements and market trends around Analytics workloads to inform the roadmap of AWS features. In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define and implement cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. Specialist Solutions Architects are thought leaders in AWS technology and industry trends in the Analytics space who create and share best practices through white papers, code samples, workshops, user groups and blog posts. If you are enthusiastic about enabling AWS customers on the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come and build the future with us. One or more of the following qualifications are desired but not required: In-depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as distributed internet-scale web applications, DevOps, Serverless, Machine Learning, high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), Master Data Management (MDM), Data Governance, Change Data Capture (CDC), highly secured workloads etc. Experience working in a customer-facing role, creating technical content or delivering enablement sessions Experience with cloud technologies including relevant industry certifications (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) Experience with migrating workloads between data centres or from on-prem to cloud Technical degree (Maths, Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or similar)

Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d) AI & Machine Learning in Frankfurt Your passion: data, AI and ML. Our goal: transforming Fin into Tech. Your future team, staffed with 15 experts, pursues this goal every day – by working on interdisciplinary projects and applying AI know-how to a range of possible application domains. You value international exchange at the highest level, think outside the box and enjoy sharing your knowledge? So do we! Join ING and stay one step ahead. Your Tasks To solve specific problems, you leverage modern machine learning techniques as well as the vast amounts of data available within the organization. Primarily, you design and/or select the best modeling solution for a given business case, control the complexity of the model and data dependencies. Plus, you choose, build, tune and evaluate machine learning models and help integrate them. When faced with a new problem, you know which methods to try first and what trade-offs are involved. By anticipating them, you find the right balance between model stability, predictive performance, fairness and explainability. You also consider privacy and ethical topics surrounding the application of AI to personal data. Add to our team and quench your thirst for learning about new techniques and tools and pushing the envelope! Your Profile Master’s degree or PhD in computer science and several years of experience in building machine learning models Solid experience with Python and its data science libraries (scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch) Versed in Natural Language Processing and its techniques: traditional (tf-idf, topic modeling) & recent (Word2vec, BERT) Know-how in Big Data platforms & tools (e. g. Apache Spark) Experienced in software development and best practices in a development team (testing, CI/CD, code reviews, etc.) Entrepreneurial mindset, passion to explore, creativity Ready to travel – up to max. 1/4 of your working time Fluent in English and willing to learn German Your Application Apply now at Germany’s leading digital bank. Just enter your personal details and upload your cover letter and resume plus credentials. The fastest way is to have your documents ready and upload them all at once.

Our analytics team empowers our customers to make well-informed, data-driven decisions through a holistic approach. We combine an expert application of new software and technologies with a unique perspective on bridging the traditional Business-IT divide. Our ability to quickly create value through innovative solutions is key to the success of our effective Business Intelligence consultancy. At InterWorks, we know the difference a quality Analytics Consultant can make to project outcomes. That is why we take pride in employing Analytics Consultants who are intelligent, articulate and passionate about their work. While a strong understanding of data analytics and a solid technological foundation are important, we strongly value the character of an Analytics Consultant and focus on their ability to meaningfully connect with customers. Analytics consultants work hand-in-hand with clients and must possess friendly and engaging personalities. Their primary goal must be to help clients understand and manipulate data in order to gain value from it. That value may be created through technical processes like SQL or ETL, or may be rooted in visual analytics tools like Tableau. Ultimately, our Analytics Consultants need to apply a variety of skillsets, from tech foundation to business application, not just meeting client needs, but exceeding them. InterWorks Analytics Consultants build projects for a diverse range of clients and industries, from Fortune 500 to local business. Our projects stretch end-to-end within the analytics spectrum, ranging from data capture & storage all the way through the board rooms forecast analysis. Project teams may include technical specialists in component disciplines as well as business focused generalists. You may work as part of a team that requires specialties in data capture and storage, ETL, data science, dashboarding, training or change management. Agile development methodologies run throughout our engagements; the ability to adapt to change quickly is crucial. InterWorks provides an exciting work environment, with a unique (and downright nerdy) company culture. Our employees are some of the most intelligent and friendly people you will ever meet, and they are the primary reason for the success of InterWorks. Joining the InterWorks team as an Analytics Consultant means joining a rapidly growing family. Skills and Requirements Here are some basic characteristics that we look for in our Analytics Consultants: Required: Excellent verbal and written communication skills Passion for interacting with people, both co-workers and clients Strong analytical and problem solving skills ETL Concepts and Best Practices for data feeding analytics systems SQL skills Business acumen and understanding of the role of business intelligence Easily adaptable and flexible to changing situations Passion for delivering compelling solutions that exceed client expectations Comfortable with 50% travel or more Presently resident in Germany Able to communicate in German at native level Highly Desired: Tableau Software Experience (Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server) BI & Analytics Tools (e.g. Oracle/Hyperion, Cognos, Qlik, or Business Objects) Big Data distributions (e.g. Cloudera CDH, Hadoop, HBase, Pig, Hive) Big Data Analytics Solutions (e.g. HP Vertica, Oracle NoSQ DBL, Hadoop Loader, EXASOL) ETL Tools (e.g. Alteryx, SyncSort, Informatica, Data Stage, SSIS, Pentaho) Application Warehouses (e.g. Teradata, Netezza, Oracle BI, SAP) About InterWorks Founded on twenty years of business consulting experience and a culture of complete client satisfaction, InterWorks delivers the absolute best in full-spectrum IT and data solutions. From servers and storage to development and visualization, our talented team leverages industry-leading technology to help organizations across the globe build a foundation for sustained success. About the Business Intelligence Team At InterWorks, we’re obsessed with data at every level. This obsession has led us to assemble the most talented team of data superheroes the world has ever seen. Wielding tools like Tableau Software and Alteryx, our Business Intelligence Team has helped Fortune 500 companies, government organizations and respected universities alike get further, faster and smarter with their data strategy. Click here for the InterWorks Privacy Policy Powered by JazzHR ReYA1EyBHy

Frankfurt, Germany Marketing / PR / Biz Dev To support our business team we are looking for a talented business analyst who is passionate about games to join our studio in Frankfurt, Germany. Responsibilities Analyzing data to identify patterns and optimization potentials and translate results into action points Develop testable hypothesis and communicate them in form of actionable recommendations to relevant teams, e.g. marketing, game design, production Develop KPIs and dashboards, and present results on a regular basis Build predictive models to help generating forecasts for business planning Work cross-functionally with the game teams, the Cryengine team, strategy and finance Analyze business landscape and keep up to date about developments in the gaming industry Responsible for data management Requirements 1-2 years games industry (GaaS) experience in data analysis Bachelor’s Degree in an analytical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Finance or related Proven analytical and quantitative skills Predictive modeling experience (e.g. with machine learning) Advanced proficiency in Python, Matlab, R or similar Experience with SQL and advanced knowledge of Excel Prior experience with data visualization (e.g. Power BI) Good knowledge of Games-as-a-Service and common KPIs Excellent problem-solving skills Excited to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies related to business intelligence and data analysis Strong communication and interpersonal skills to translate ambiguous business requirements into complex analyses and actionable insights Good English communication and writing skills Willing to relocate to Frankfurt am Main area, Germany. What you can expect from us A refreshing yet highly professional atmosphere in a diverse team. Flexible work time. FUN. Free public transportation ticket, which lets you use public transport free of charge 24/7. Free onsite German lessons for our employees and partners / spouses. Company language is English. Any additional language is a plus, but not a requirement. Extensive assistance with getting visa, work permits and communication with local authorities. Relocation support. A company apartment for your first few months and help in finding a private apartment....and many more!

YOUR TASKS: Conception and development of forecasting models (e.g. order forecast) and more complex analytics solutions Use of data mining, statistical modeling and machine learning approaches Identification, procurement and processing of relevant data Active search for possible further use cases for data science Testing and evaluating new methods, technologies and best practices for use in the company YOUR PROFILE: You have already completed a large part of your studies in (business) computer science, mathematics or physics You have experience in data science, data analytics and business intelligence You have a deeper understanding of database structures and data preparation You have experience in using R, Python or KNIME You can establish and recognize complex relationships between our business processes and a wide variety of data You have strong analytical and conceptual skills and can make your evaluations transparent You work systematically, you are independent and you bring your own initiative Good communication skills in both German and English, both spoken and written High commitment, ability to work in a team and flexibility. YOUR CHANCE: Exciting tasks with a lot of creative freedom within a flat hierarchy and open communication culture Strong team spirit at regular team events, shared lunch breaks, etc. Successful future and diverse development and career prospects in a rapidly growing and very varied company Category: Development Marketing Employment type: full-time Location: Frankfurt home office

This is what youll do: Build data pipelines that feed both the development and deployment of machine learning models Design and develop conceptual data models for integrating, exploring, and retrieving data from heterogeneous data sources and systems Implement and manage ETL processes, data transformations, data flows and service APIs Work with data virtualization, integration, and analytics technologies Implement optimized data representations (views) and aggregations from multiple data sources Select features, build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques This is what youll bring to us: Degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or in a related field Experience in data visualization using open source and commercial tools (Tableau/Power BI) Deep interest in data science and the development of machine learning models Strong experience with Python, and its common machine learning libraries Very good knowledge of database fundamentals Keen interest in data science and its applications Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks English communication skills (spoken & written) This is what we offer: Responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day The opportunity to work on challenging tasks that contribute to your professional growth Work independently and as part of a dedicated, international team The opportunity to help shape our company culture Make an impact initiating new ideas Work with and learn from experts in diverse fields Get to know your team members at our exciting company events This is who we are: We are Emma – The Sleep Company. We disrupt sleep by pushing the boundaries of what technology can do for rest. Our aim is to make a positive impact on people’s lives everywhere by enhancing their sleep. We are one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech startups with 400+ team members representing over 40 nationalities at our headquarters in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. Our work culture is built on strong values promoting community, agility, and ownership. Growth and excellence in all areas are important to us, which is why we offer our team members opportunities to develop and advance professionally and personally. Emma proudly celebrates diversity. What to expect For our ambitious and growing Data Intelligence department, we are looking for a senior algorithm developer with a strong background in state-of-the-art machine learning methods. In this position, you will work on learning-based solutions for a variety of tasks in medical data analysis with a particular focus on the processing of medical images and videos (e.g. image segmentation, object detection and more) exploit the ever increasing amount of medical data in order to push the limits of intelligent software components for medical procedure support have the chance to drive your creative ideas from initial prototypes up to their final product release share your knowledge and provide technical guidance to your colleagues in the development team ultimately have impact on the daily work of medical professionals around the world What you offer Education in mathematics, physics, computer science or similar background Profound demonstrated experience in using modern machine learning methods along with classic computer vision approaches to solve challenging problems in the area of image processing Ideally, you have worked on a PhD in a relevant area or gained this experience during a range of projects in an industrial setting Strong mathematical background and interest, allowing you to understand modern machine learning methods in all their details, and making you eager to adapt and further develop these methods in your daily work Good confidence in using the Python ecosystem for efficient prototyping of your ideas Strong interest and skills in software engineering and object oriented programming (ideally in C++), allowing you to integrate your algorithms within a complex software framework Eagerness to be part of a high-skilled, dynamic team where your talent is both, challenged and supported Fluency in English and ideally German (or willingness to learn German) What we offer Centrally located, modern work spaces 30 days of vacation plus, 24.12. and 31.12. Flexible working hours Free gym courses with showers and changing rooms Secure bicycle storage room Free coffee, tea and water Restaurant, Coffee Shop available Regular after work, team & company events Sheltered terrace on the Bavarian Towers International team of supportive colleagues Comprehensive training and continuing education opportunities Interested? What to expect We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our ambitious and growing Data Intelligence Team. In this role you will leverage your strong passion for understanding and modeling complex medical data to gain new insights and push the boundaries of software-supported medical procedures. As a Data Scientist, you will develop a deep understanding for medical data from multiple sources, including images, patient demographics, and treatment information design, train and optimize algorithms to solve challenging data modeling tasks, thereby combining various data types in innovative ways make use of state-of-the-art machine learning methods to extract information from big and diverse data sets work together with clinical experts in order to identify relevant questions, challenge your findings and evaluate their impact on real-world medical environments What you offer Education in mathematics, physics, computer science or similar Profound experience in modeling complex data, ideally in the medical field Strong analytical, mathematical background and interest, allowing you to understand modern machine learning methods in all their details and making you eager to adapt and further develop these methods in your daily work Ideally, experience in image processing Strong background in using the Python ecosystem for efficient prototyping of your ideas, combined with a passion for and initial experience in (object-oriented) programming Eagerness to be part of a high-skilled, dynamic team where your talent is both challenged and supported Fluency in English, some knowledge of German (or willingness to learn) is a plus What we offer Centrally located, modern work spaces 30 days of vacation, plus 24.12. and 31.12. Flexible working hours Free gym courses with showers and changing rooms Secure bicycle storage room Unlimited coffee, tea and bottled water Restaurant and coffee shop on-site Regular after-work, team & company events Sheltered terrace on the Bavarian Towers International team of supportive colleagues Comprehensive training and continuing education opportunities Interested? Then we are looking forward to receiving your online application! One of my clients based in Frankfurt area is looking for a Data Scientist / Bioinformatician- Life Science (m/f/d): Required Experience : 3 years + Responsibilities Cross-functional collaboration to support integration of finished algorithms and prototypes into products. Deep Learning and Machine learning hands on experiences Experiences with Biological data, molecular biology, computational biology, proteomics and genomics data Create intellectual property for the organization and write patent disclosures for them. Support sales and business development teams to fine-tune client requirements, perform feasibility testing and proposing approach for solutions. Demonstrate thought leadership by participating in national & international conferences represent the organization and publishing blogs, white papers etc. Required experience Strong, demonstrable experience developing new deep learning models (NLP, Image Processing, Computer Vision, Speech Recognition) and machine learning over unstructured data. Hands on experience of deploying Machine Learning or Deep Learning based solutions in production with large datasets. Strong understanding of Python and Machine Learning libraries (NumPy, SciPy, sklearn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras). More than 3 years of relevant experience in industry (Life Sciene + NLP) Good writing skills demonstrated by patents, publications, blogs or personal pages. Fluent in English, German is an advantage Work Permit is an absolute must. Required qualification Biotech or equivalent in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Maths or related domain. Higher education will add on it.

Your new job You will be working closely together with the ERP / BI Architect to develop, enhance and maintain the ngena Enterprise Data Warehouse and its logical data model (data sources for the BI include, but are not limited to, BSS/OSS data, resources databases and quotation applications) Support the maintenance of the underlying logical data and multidimensional data models Based on the Data Warehouse data, you will create standard reports and charts and maintain regular publishing processes or support ad hoc queries Supporting our technology partners with ETL processes Assessing, analyzing and managing change implications Your assets You have successfully completed your university degree in computer science or a similar subject Youve been working as a DW / BI developer or consultant for a few years already and possess good know-how in BI / EDW architecture Youre an expert in relational and multidimensional data modelling and possess a profound understanding of DW principles (Kimball or Inman) MS SQL Server database management and MS SQL Studio belong to your key skills (certifications desirable) Good working knowledge and experience in SSAS and SSIS (certifications desirable) Familiarity with at least one Report Generator / BI Front End Tool; skills in Oracle, Apex or/and Tableau would be great Good know-how in a data modelling tool A background in requirements management and software development would be nice Communicating fluently in English is no problem for you, and if you know some German - even better! Nice to have: JSON knowledge, real time warehousing knowledge, knowledge of the telco industry, processes (eTOM) and data, ITIL/ITSM You want to work and flourish in a multicultural team and enjoy working in an agile environment Conceptional, analytical and logical thinking come natural to you Your chance An exciting, dynamic, international start-up environment awaits you with an open corporate culture of flat hierarchies. At ngena, responsibility will be in your hands from the very beginning. You will continuously grow both on the professional and personal front amongst a diverse team of more than 20 nationalities, varied age groups and a wide range of skill-sets. This fusion will prepare you for paving the world with ngena’s leading SDWAN technology. What we offer Challenging tasks with room for creativity and development opportunities within the company An international team of highly motivated colleagues within a dynamic startup company Working in an open corporate culture of flat hierarchies and short decision-making paths A state-of-the-art workplace

Your assignments Identification and evaluation of Business Analytics use cases Development and support in the implementation of reporting & analytical models for manufacturing activities Monitoring, quality assurance and improvement of productive analytical models Data visualization and dashboard design Help to foster and further drive our analytics culture, e.g. through assistance in or leading of trainings and workshops Preparation of management decisions regarding strategic analytics topics Build, strengthen and maintain close and good relationships to all involved stakeholders Your profile Graduate degree (Master) in Business Administration, Business Informatics, Business Mathematics, Computer Science or comparable studies 1 – 3 years of professional experience and profound know-how on business processes and the underlying IT Systems, especially around manufacturing activities Demonstrated knowledge in Data Science-related projects or functions Very good software development/engineering skills (Python, R) with focus on analytical models (e.g. classification, time series, machine learning) Good knowledge of Business Intelligence activities (ETL processes, Data-Modelling, SQL, Meta-data management) Good knowledge of data visualization tools, e.g. SAP Analysis for Office/Analytics Cloud, Microsoft Power BI and/or Grafana Fluent in English and German, both written and spoken Ability to structure and simplify complex tasks Excellent communication skills as well as willingness and ability to lead projects Execution-oriented mindset combined with a high level of pro-activity and pragmatism Offen für Individualität und Vielfalt Fresenius begrüßt Bewerbungen aller Menschen, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Alter, Herkunft, Nationalität, Religion, Behinderung, sexueller Identität und Orientierung oder sonstigen Merkmalen. Sämtliche Personenbezeichnungen in dieser Stellenausschreibung gelten für alle Geschlechter gleichermaßen (männlich, weiblich, divers). Karriere mit Sinn Mehr als 300.000 Menschen auf allen Kontinenten arbeiten bei Fresenius daran, immer bessere Medizin für immer mehr Menschen anzubieten. Unsere eigenständigen Unternehmensbereiche Fresenius Medical Care, Fresenius Kabi, Fresenius Helios und Fresenius Vamed bieten ein breites Spektrum an Produkten und Dienstleistungen im Gesundheitssektor. Bei uns haben Sie die Chance, mit Ihrer Karriere einen Unterschied zu machen – und Teil unserer beeindruckenden Wachstumsgeschichte zu werden.

document: A great opportunity for technical expert in the field of Docker driven workflows and operations with Kubernetes. If you have a passion for technology and business, experience in cloud-native software engineering, deep familiarity with open source, Kubernetes, container technology and Linux, and awareness of open source community leadership best practices, then you will love the Docker and Kubernetes leadership role at Canonical. Container technology continues to reshape enterprise technology operations and practices. Ubuntu is widely deployed in cloud-native environments, and Canonical has created a role for product leadership of an array of cloud-native offerings. Our customers set the pace in technology at scale, leading the adoption of new ideas and practices. Our goal is to shape the future of cloud-native operations, across public and private infrastructure, in partnership with industry leaders. This role encompasses leadership of the product and go-to-market for cloud-native offerings. It requires an analytical storyteller with a strong sense of message. We prefer graduate professionals with software engineering management experience who want to become business executives and entrepreneurs, to define product strategy and drive engagement. Product leadership at Canonical is data-driven and content-centric. Product performance is closely measured and this team participates in regular reviews with company leadership. You will join a growing team and help shape the message across our suite of products, with a particular focus on containers, Kubernetes, Docker, enterprise open source applications and projects. You will create effective content to engage sophisticated technical and commercial audiences, and work closely with marketing, media, engineering, sales, research, consulting, and training teams. You will be accountable for product go-to-market execution, marketing collateral, case studies, training, and blog posts. You will be expected to deliver measurable lead-gen and awareness. The successful candidate will be multi-talented, with: A rigorous technical or science background and supporting qualifications Software engineering management experience Experience in Kubernetes operations and the cloud-native landscape Experience in open source project and community leadership Business and commercial interests A proven history of leadership and presentation skills A strong work ethic, and personal interests aligned with the field Awareness of Ubuntu and Canonicals competition and tactical opportunities Track record of data-driven decision-making Proven ability to write about technology and the tech landscape

At CLARK we believe that the significant things in life should be simple. With this vision in mind, we have set out to create an application which makes it easier, simpler, and faster for consumers to manage their insurances - all in one central place where changes can be done with just a few clicks. Our secret sauce is to combine a best-in-industry user experience with honest and independent advice from insurance experts. Since our founding in 2015, we have served over 200,000 satisfied customers. We are extremely proud of our 200 employees from over 40 nations, working from our offices in Berlin, Frankfurt, Vienna and Püttlingen. We were recognized by the German tech magazine Gründerszene as the fastest growing technology company in Germany for 2019. We want your help to get us to the next level. What is this about? To help us grow and scale new markets, we are looking for a Data Scientist, who will be responsible for leveraging the vast amount of data within and outside the organisation to automate and improve the decision making process at Clark. What you will be doing Reporting to the Head of Business Intelligence and working closely with the Product team to iteratively create data science roadmap, assess use cases for feasibility and business impacts and implement the use cases. Collaborating with our BI analysts to choose, build, evaluate and tune machine learning models to support automatic decision-making processes at Clark in all areas: marketing, product, sales, finance, etc. Linking up and Aligning with the Architecture team to build technically sound and well-maintained data pipelines to constantly enrich, prepare and analyze data, as well as to deploy machine learning models to production environments. Who you are An analytical thinker with exceptional conceptual skills, and the ability to make your evaluations transparent, not only to your team but also to non-technical audiences. A fast Learner and are always eager to learn new domains and technologies A fluent communicator: You feel confident and comfortable when explaining a complex problem to your audience in English. German language is a big plus!. What you ideally have You have a Masters degree or a PhD in computer science, Mathematics, Economics or other quantitative fields. You have at Least 5 years of experience in building machine learning models ”‘in the wild”, including their deployment in enterprise production systems to drive real business impacts. You have experience in applying machine learning and data science algorithms to solve real-life business problems and even better if you also have experience in recommender systems, text analytics, sentiment analysis and voice recognition. You are confident in your knowledge of big data platforms & tools such as apache spark and databricks. Experience in software development and best practices in a development team (e.g testing, CI/CD Code reviews) rounds up your profile. Why CLARK Everyone offers perks like free coffee, free drinks, flat hierarchies. We offer you all that but more in the shape of: A multicultural environment with international colleagues. Subsidized job ticket and a company pension. A lot of freedom: You want to pursue further education? An MBA was always a dream of yours? We offer you support for your education while working with us. Support for relocation - and we dont mean only a work permit. The process of getting you here and the costs associated with it are all supported. Fear of not speaking the language? We offer beginner and advanced German and English classes in house. Want to inspire and share knowledge? We have you covered with our weekly Tech Brown Bag speech. And last but not least: Sure, we know how to celebrate success! We offer you quarterly company events, monthly team lunch & breakfast as well as our weekly Friday get together. Sounds exciting? We agree, and we cannot wait to have your application!

RWE Supply & Trading GmbH, Essen, Germany (DE) or Swindon / London, United Kingdom (UK) To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent A newly created permanent full-time role within the Trading IT arena at RWE Supply & Trading GmbH. Could be located in either Essen (Germany), London (UK) or Swindon (UK), with some travel between sites required. Although the role is full-time, we do have some degree of flex with working times – we are happy to discuss this at the interview stage. It’s an exciting time to join us! RWE Supply & Trading is implementing a new Data & Analytics platform to make the sharing, searching, transforming and on-boarding of data simple and efficient. Data is fundamental to the company’s business model and will become an ever increasing asset in the future. As part of a new and expanding multi-disciplinary team you will play a key role in the company wide initiative. We are developing a cloud-based platform and infrastructure using the latest tech, capable of cleaning, transforming and efficiently storing data, running on-demand as well as scheduled models, and integrating with pre-existing technology. The initiative is sponsored by the Board and is a key enabler for the company’s commercial strategy. Therefore, we are looking for an experienced individual to join us. Someone who will play a key role in shaping and building the platform from the very beginning, influencing how it is built and the technical decisions we take. If this sounds appealing, then apply now! Your responsibilities As part of your role as an interdisciplinary AWS Cloud Expert, you will: Take ownership of the technical challenge to automate the build of cloud environments to support our strategic data platform. Want to work in a supportive collaborative environment focused on delivering value to our users. Be a specialist for cloud architecture and cloud native solutions, define tools, designs, architecture and work with several vendors in the market to take ownership of great technical roll-outs. Be a real technical problem solver, able to create awesome solutions for complex requirements with a hands-on attitude. Specialise in various automation techniques in delivering Cloud native Services using a wide range of technologies. Keep up to date with new trends in cloud always looking to new solutions to solve complex problems. Have a detailed understanding of Windows and Linux Infrastructure, enabling us to understand Infrastructure as Code to become more independent from Infrastructure support teams. Your profile We are looking for someone with: Several years proven experience in the mentioned technical skills Fluent in English (verbal and written) A degree in, or related to Computer Science or Mathematics or equivalent experience Experience of leading a DevOps team Versatile technical experience of cloud platforms, automation and continuous software delivery Strong PaaS, IaaS experiences within AWS Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, AWS CDK, CloudFormation etc.) Fundamental experiences in CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps Server, GitLab or similar) Version Control: GIT, Bitbucket Deployment tools: Team City, Jenkins or similar Continuous configuration automation (e.g. Ansible, or Chef, or Puppet) Hands on experience with of Amazon Web Services including S3, Redshift, Athena, KMS, IAM, CloudTrail, Glue Experience in development and scripting (e.g. in Shell, Python, Ruby, Bash, Shell) Good working experiences with Windows and Linux server AWS Certifications to professional level, preferable Experience working in AWS Networking, preferable Experience building and supporting robust and scalable big data platforms, preferable Knowledge of skills in Cloud security, preferable What we value most is passion, willingness to learn and a determined and resilient work ethic. So, if you can display most of the skills above then we would like to hear from you. Our offer Working alongside our traders and analysts on this initiative gives you the opportunity to shape the commercial business from an IT perspective! Right from the beginning you’ll be making a difference within your team and this will be supplemented by a variety of comprehensive on the job learning. We are also able to offer you the following: Working in one of the most interesting business contexts; a mixture of energy supply, trading and of course IT! Working in an agile team on things which matter Competitive salary plus annual discretionary bonus Open and diverse company culture Contact rwe.com/career Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code 23306 Any questions? Christina Beatrix Hoppe (Recruiting), T: +49 201 5179-3257 We look forward to meeting you! We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications, irrespective of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion and beliefs, age or sexual orientation and identity. Of course, you can find us on LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter and Xing, too. RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for people around the world. To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future. 170 traders in the energy business, 290 experts on Europe’s largest energy trading floor and 1,100 additional professionals. Join RWE Supply & Trading and shape the future of the trading business to make energy clean, reliable and affordable.

We are a full-service public accounting firm located at Queens Quay East and Lower Jarvis, Toronto, providing a full range of accounting, assurance, tax and business advisory services. We are looking for a Senior Bookkeeper on a full-time basis to join our Controllership team.The successful candidate will manage the full-cycle accounting function for multiple companies, working closely with them to prioritize your work to meet their business needs. You will be challenged with handling a variety of bookkeeping tasks including the following:
Calculate and prepare cheques for payroll

Keep financial records and establish, maintain and balance various accounts using manual and computerized bookkeeping systems
Maintain general ledgers and financial statements
Post journal entries
Prepare other statistical, financial and accounting reports
Prepare tax returns
Prepare trial balance of books
Reconcile accounts
Prepare T4 statements and other statements

Prepare bank reconciliations

Invoice clients

Prepare and verify statements of earnings for employees, indicating gross and net salaries and deductions such as taxes, union dues, garnishments and insurance and pension plans
Accept payment or invoices for items delivered
Compile and maintain records on operating expenses and income
Willing to travel to client sites in the GTA
Required Skills & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting
Knowledge of ACCPAC, Caseware/Caseview, Quick Books, Simply Accounting, TaxPrep, Sage Accounting Software would be an asset
Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)
Must be organized, able to multitask, prioritize, work independently and under pressure
Ability to independently manage the accounting needs of various clients in different industries
Punctuality and good communication skills are expected
Able to communicate professionally with clients
Maintain confidentiality at all times
Available to travel to client sites
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $45,500.00-$52,000.00 per year
TO APPLY:
If you have the skills and experience required for this position, please forward your resume to:
E-mail: amanda@kanish-partners.com

document:
Finishing & Fabrication Specialists
The objective of these roles is to understand the scope of the project and accurately complete it from start to finish. The Finishing & Fabrication Specialists fabricate, assemble, bind, and finish all of the components to complete a project while allowing sufficient time for the order to be delivered. For each step in the process, the Specialists are responsible to prioritize daily production and organize materials needed for the next job; in doing so, they use materials & time responsibly to minimize delays. They are part of a production team that has the satisfaction of seeing their good work materialize into great projects and products for our customers.
How you will make an impact
Strong customer service experience
Able to collaborate with the customer to achieve their vision
Following the work order details, plan and execute the project from the printing process to the finishing and shipping to the customer on time every time.
Estimating time requirements for project completion including customer needs, machine capabilities and resources
To set up, operate and troubleshoot equipment correctly and in accordance with safety standards while maintaining production standards and efficiencies
Working safely to trim, custom cut, laminate and transform digital print products into high quality products that exceed our customer's expectations
Perform routine preventative maintenance on equipment to keep it performing at optimal levels
Inspect finished work for quality control and accuracy
Problem solving in a fast-paced manufacturing environment
Collaborate with the team to innovate new products and finishes
A desire to learn and back up other team members
Skills and Experience
Thorough knowledge of materials/substrates used in a digital printing environment
Ability to follow processes and procedures safely and accurately
Safely lifting and loading and moving materials and substrates that range up to 50 lbs consistently
Computer literate with knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, Acrobat Pro, MS Office
Knowledge of the digital, offset and/or large format printing process is an asset
Experience with pre-press software is an asset
Knowledge of Zund Cutter or Digital Cutting tables operation is an asset
Welcoming Applications from Arriving Ukrainians
Considering the ongoing humanitarian crisis in Ukraine, TPH is committed to help provide employment opportunities to displaced individuals and refugees as they arrive in Canada. If you have a background in manufacturing or technology and are interested in any of the positions listed above, please apply with your resume and contact information and a member of our recruitment team will reach out to you
About Us
Since 1961 we have served Canadians as part of the community. TPH is delighted to join the list of respected organizations that have been recognized as one of Canada's Greenest Employers of 2021. As a result of our environmental initiatives, The Printing House was rated North America's most forest-friendly printer in Canopy's 2019 Blueline Ranking, the only comprehensive assessment of the environmental performance of North America's printers.
Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
TPH is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you believe TPH is a good fit for you, feel free to submit your application, we would love to hear from you.
TO APPLY:
For more information or to apply now, you must go to https://tph.prevueaps.ca/jobs/20454-12049.html
Please DO NOT email your resume to us as we only accept applications through our website.

The Opportunity…
As a Customer Relationship Specialist, you'll be responsible for providing courteous, accurate and timely responses to incoming inquiries. This is an extremely important role within the Canada Life team as you are often the first point of contact for plan members with questions about GroupNet for Plan Members and GRS Access portals. The Integrated Member Site (IMS) will help support the member's financial, physical and mental well-being throughout their lifecycle.
Responsibilities include:
Effectively troubleshoot/resolve customer log-ins, medical, dental and drug telephone/email inquiries using various systems and tools in a timely fashion
Become a subject matter expert in the new Integrated Member Site, along with GroupNet for Plan Members and GRS Access websites
Actively participate in an ongoing learning environment where you'll receive developmental opportunities
You:
Have superior customer service skills and are an effective listener
Are resilient and able to handle the stress of a ‘real-time' environment
Have a natural curiosity and are a critical thinker
Are comfortable in a highly structured work environment
Have an optimistic outlook and have a positive approach to work
Possess strong organizational and time management skills
Have excellent Microsoft Office skills and an ability to learn multiple computer systems, both Windows-based and other
Have strong verbal and written communication skills
Have demonstrated the ability to solve problems through investigation and make timely decisions
Have a high school diploma or equivalent
What we offer…
Full time hours
Paid two-week training program, followed by 2-3 weeks of mentorship
Three paid Personal days, paid vacation, and a wellness account
Excellent benefits and Pension plan
Hybrid-firm work environment
Option to participate in the Share Ownership Program
Bonus plan based on your individual performance
Education reimbursement program $2,000 (annually)
Career advancement options
Being a part of a great team!
TO APPLY:
Please submit your resume to Shantelle Robillard at shantelle@legacybowes.com
Preference will be given to qualified Indigenous candidates. Please self declare on your application.
Legacy Bowes is an Indigenous owned organization that strives to provide a welcoming recruitment experience for all and create equal opportunity for Indigenous persons within all our relations.

We are seeking a talented and creative Graphic Designer to join our team. The Graphic Designer will be responsible for designing a wide range of marketing and communication materials, including but not limited to, website layouts, digital and print advertisements, logos, brochures, and presentations. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of design principles and aesthetics, excellent communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

Design visually appealing and engaging marketing and communication materials
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to develop concepts and design solutions
Create designs that are on-brand and aligned with marketing objectives
Manage multiple design projects from concept to completion
Ensure all designs are high-quality and meet deadlines
Conduct research on industry trends and stay up-to-date with design software and technologies
Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field
Proven experience as a Graphic Designer or a similar role
Strong understanding of design principles, aesthetics, and color theory
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign
Familiarity with digital design, including website layouts, social media graphics, and email marketing campaigns
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, including the ability to present design concepts and ideas
Strong attention to detail and the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Knowledge of typography, layout, and print design
Preferred qualifications:

Experience with video and motion graphics software such as After Effects or Premiere Pro
Knowledge of HTML and CSS
Experience with UX/UI design
Understanding of branding and brand guidelines
TO APPLY:
If you are a creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer who enjoys collaborating with cross-functional teams and is passionate about design, we encourage you to apply for this position.

E-mail: waqar@siteuniverse.io

We offer a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, and the opportunity to work on exciting projects with a talented team of designers and marketers.

document:
The Job at a Glance

Parts Town Canada is seeking a Senior Manager, Customer Service (Parts Expert) whose primary responsibility is to oversee a team that provides exceptional service through phone calls and emails while maintaining customer relationships and building new ones.

This leader will coach, train and mentor a fast-growing team of Parts Experts, Team Leads, Supervisors and Managers. The Senior Manager will continually seek methods to enhance customer experience while striving for sales growth by working with the team and partnering with key customers to understand business needs. A dedication to delivering an unforgettable customer experience, strong personal development skills and communication are essential to the success in this leadership role.

We are just as excited about this role as you are so don't delay and send in your application today.

A Typical Day

Strengthens key customer relationships by scheduling routine meetings and proactively collecting feedback.
Maintaining customer excellence by understanding current technical knowledge and skills of Customer Experience team members.
Responsible for coaching, mentoring, hiring, training and onboarding of all Customer Experience team members and leaders.
Partners with other divisions across the company to when resolving customer escalations while establishing long term solutions.
Analyzes business performance and works with Segment leaders on sales growth strategies including outbound phone calls, market analysis, attending relevant business events, etc.
Continue to innovate and optimize the various technology platforms used to enhance Canadian customer and employee experiences.
Budget contribution as related to P&L, EBITDA, Labour Productivity, Margin improvements, etc.
Oversee Leader functions within each segment to achieve customer service level objectives (Call answer rate, email response time, etc.)
Coaches, mentors and motivates leaders and members to strive for customer service excellence and improved productivity.
Creates and manages employee schedules as per business needs and approves payroll.
Implements and maintains a training and coaching structure for continuous employee development and career growth including scheduled 1on1s, call coaching and performance appraisals.
Address performance concerns by partnering with Team Leads and Managers and following steps to progressive counselling.
To Land This Opportunity

5 years of management experience preferably in the distribution industry
Minimum High school graduation required
Strong working knowledge of motivation, training, appraisal and general supervisory skills (direct responsibility of teams of 10+)
Leadership ability and team building skills to effectively supervise professional staff
Experience in budget management and a track record of delivering service excellence
Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment
Experience using Sales Force is an asset
 

About Your Future Team

Our team truly likes each other, works really well together and we have fun every day. We LOVE to eat, talk sports, essential oils, meditation and food. We do a lot of fun activities, we love dogs, coffee and of course chocolate...a lot.

TO APPLY:
For more information or to apply now, you must go to https://partstown.prevueaps.com/jobs/218234-57202.html

Please DO NOT email your resume to us as we only accept applications through our website.

Job description

The Flight Follower position ensures that all flights are planned, organized, supported and followed accurately and efficiently. This position is central to effective communication between flight crew, operations and management.

Responsibilities:

Adhere to the company's policies and procedures
Undertake flight alerting procedures and respond to requests by the pilot-in-command for information related to the flight. Such information shall include meteorological information and NOTAMS
Monitor the progress of each flight from its commencement to its termination, including any intermediate stops
Communicate with the pilot-in-command concerning airplane landings and departures from point of origin, en-route stops, and final destination
Notify the Communications Center (“OCC”) of acceptance and ETA times for all flights
Ensure the pertinent software systems are kept updated in a timely manner including building flights, pairings; and monitoring alerts and currency
Utilizing flight planning software for issuing (adding, amending, deleting) company NOTAMS
File flight plans on behalf of flight crew members; and monitor weather alerts and advise flight crew accordingly
Liaise with Nav Canada with regard to updating and cancelling flight plans
Track crew and aircraft down-time and duty days
Activate Emergency Response Plan if required
Complete comprehensive daily Shift Report
Track response times and delays as well as on time performance
Accomplish other assigned duties, as requested.
Qualifications:

Post-Secondary Diploma
Proven organisational skills
Excellent customer service skills
Have initiative and ability to work autonomously
Attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure
Proven interpersonal and communication skills
The post holder must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office packages (MS Word and MS Excel are essential)
Available to work shift hours in a 24/7 operation
Background in aviation is essential
The above detail of key accountabilities is not intended to be an exhaustive listing and the post-holder may be expected to accept additional / amended responsibilities in line with the company's needs. Such additions / amendments will be in line with the capabilities of the post-holder.

IMP is committed to Employment Equity and our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative at all job levels. NOC 13102

Trappers Transport Ltd. is an industry leader aspiring to be the best-in-class provider of temperature-controlled food logistics services. We manage over 40,000 truckloads of freight annually and maintain close to 1.4 billion pounds of food products delivered to consumers worldwide. We boast one of the largest temperature-controlled warehousing, logistics, and transportation networks within Canada and the United States. Our customers are provided with innovative full-service logistic solutions to help reduce overall costs and enhance marketplace competitiveness.

Our brand is a reflection of our core values – great people, a great culture, and a team environment that promotes everyone to succeed. We are committed to each and every member of our team to provide training, and a safe and respectful work environment, within a clean and comfortable working environment. We are proud to share our state-of-the-art transportation facility with all of our employees.

For more information, visit www.trapperstransport.com and follow us on LinkedIn.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking to fill a Full-Time Permanent Payroll Administrator in our Head Quarters office in Winnipeg.

Candidate Requirement

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, with a strong aptitude for learning new technology tools
Attention to detail
Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines
As our Payroll Administrator, you will report to the Payroll Manager, and your duties will encompass but not be limited to the following:

Receive trip jackets/time sheets from drivers, owner-operators, and the Billing Administrator
Accurately process the trip jackets/time sheets – ensuring drivers and owner-operators are accurately paid for mileage, picks, drops, layovers, hooks, unhooks, expense reimbursements, and other pay based on our internal operations system
Print and review driver/owner-operator statements and ensure all related trip jackets and other supporting documents are attached to each statement
Filing the pay statements with finalized trip jackets once the pay has been completed
Input of mileage information for driver/owner-operator bonus purposes
Other trip jacket processing duties as assigned
We offer competitive compensation and a benefits program. A career with Trappers Transport provides you with the opportunity to develop your own potential. We offer an open-minded, family environment and a work culture that empowers its employees to thrive.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $19.00 - $23.00

Benefits:

Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Vision care
Schedule:

8-hour shift
Supplemental pay types:

Overtime pay
Note:

No access to public transport. Must have own transportation
Experience:

Payroll: 3 years (required) 
 

Where: In person

TO APPLY:
If you have the skills and experience required for this position, please forward your resume to:

E-mail: payroll@trapperstransport.com

Trappers Transports is an equal-opportunity employer with a strong commitment to the individual and collective growth of our employees and a commitment to diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

document:
The Registered Nurse (RN) supports Lookout's Overdose Prevention Space, TiOAT Program at the Wellness and Recovery Centre in Duncan under the direction of the Program Manager. The Wellness and Recovery Centre guests may also be connected with addiction, health care and community services. The people we serve may have a variety of challenging and often overlapping problems including serious mental illness, substance abuse (including IV drug use), hygiene issues, treatment (medical, psychiatric and rehab), and increasingly HIV+/Aids. Harm Reduction Workers provide the necessary support including intake and orienting guests, and support for meeting the needs of clients, as well as education on harm reduction methods and distribution of harm reduction supplies. The LPN deals with the public, other service agencies and professionals involved in the support of the clients.

Job Duties: (in brief)

Provide medical assessments to clients of the TiOAT Program and the Wellness Recovery Program
Responsible for medication management of clients of the TiOAT Program and the Wellness Recovery Program
Prescribe medications as necessary through the TiOAT Program and the Wellness Recovery Program
Work as a collaborative team, with Management, Coordinators and external agencies to provide harm reduction supplies, support and the information necessary to help participants access and use this facility
Observe clients who are consuming drugs, assessing for and managing signs of overdose, and when necessary, administering drugs to counter an overdose, according to established protocols
Provide crisis intervention and/or extraordinary services where appropriate.
Provide education and guidance on safe injection practices, assess clients' other health/socioeconomic needs and provide support and direction to services as appropriate.
Qualifications & Competencies:

Current practicing registration as a Registered Nurse or Registered Psychiatric Nurse with the BC College of Nurses and Midwives (BCCNM).
Demonstrated ability in nursing practice related to clients in chronic addiction
Knowledge of the principles and practices of a client centered recovery model in mental illness.
Broad knowledge of:
Crisis intervention and counseling skills.
Mental health illness and treatment.
Psychopharmacology (indication and side effects).
Substance abuse and addictions treatment.
Other facilities and community resources.
Demonstrated ability to:
Conduct psychiatric assessments.
Provide treatment planning, counseling, crisis intervention, and case coordination.
Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, with clients, and other health care staff, both one-on-one and in groups.
Apply decision making and analytical skills
Work collaboratively as a member of an interdisciplinary team
Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
Effectively deal with conflict situations
Plan, organize and prioritize work
Demonstrated skill in CPR techniques.
Demonstrated knowledge of the harm reduction model, Mental Health System and related agencies and Addiction Support organizations.
Must have current OFA 1 First Aid Certificate and negative TB Test
Must have 2 doses of COVID-19 Vaccines Naloxone Training an asset
Crisis Intervention Skills Training an asset
Demonstrated ability in dealing with a variety of situations and responsibilities requiring initiative, creativity and professional judgment.
Ability to deal with clients with mental health and substance abuse issues
Broad knowledge of harm reduction approach to client care
Demonstrated physical ability to perform the duties of the position
Knowledge and experience with basic computer programs (Word, Microsoft Outlook)
Criminal Record Clearance – vulnerable sector
Lookout Housing and Health Society is committed to empowering people from different races, gender, age, religion, identities and unique experiences. We welcome everyone from diverse backgrounds and encourage them to apply in order to foster an inclusive environment

TO APPLY:
If you have the skills and experience required for this position, please forward your resume to:

E-mail: heather.tran@lookoutsociety.ca

Job Description:

As an IoT Trainer for RC Car and Drone Building, you will be responsible for teaching students the fundamentals of IoT and how it can be used in building RC cars and drones. Your primary goal is to help students develop a strong foundation in IoT concepts and prepare them for future challenges in the field. You will also be responsible for creating lesson plans, developing teaching materials, and evaluating student progress.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop IoT curriculum for RC car and drone building
Teach students basic IoT concepts such as sensors, actuators, microcontrollers, and wireless communication protocols
Guide students in building and programming RC cars and drones using IoT technology
Provide personalized support and feedback to students to help them develop their skills
Develop and maintain teaching materials, including lesson plans, presentations, and exercises
Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback and assessment
Collaborate with other instructors to continuously improve the curriculum
Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, IoT or related field
Experience teaching IoT and building RC cars or drones
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to design and implement effective teaching strategies
Passion for teaching and mentoring students
Familiarity with IoT development tools and technologies such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi, and IoT sensors and actuators
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changes in the curriculum or schedule.
TO APPLY:
If you meet these requirements and are passionate about teaching IoT for RC car and drone building, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

E-mail: vish@rpttech.ca

Arctic Gateway Group LP (AGG) is a majority-owned indigenous company headquartered in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Through our operating companies, Hudson Bay Railway Corp. (HBR), Hudson Bay Port Corp. (HBPC) and the Churchill Marine Tank Farm Corp. (CMTF), we provide transportation and logistical support to a variety of customers and industries.

Including our Administration Office in Winnipeg, Manitoba, we are geographically dispersed throughout Northern Manitoba with several remote employees. The Executive Assistant will provide high level administrative support to the CEO and Senior Management Team of AGG.

The incumbent will be highly organized, proactive and possess excellent communication and time management skills. The Executive Assistant will be responsible for developing effective internal and external messaging with all stakeholders, optimizing research on multiple projects, and establishing systems and processes for board engagements.

Key Responsibilities

Prepare and distribute correspondence, meeting agendas, minutes, and other materials as required.
Prepare reports and PowerPoint presentations as needed.
Manage and prioritize incoming emails, mail, and phone calls, and respond to inquiries as appropriate or as directed.
Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.
Assist with special projects and other tasks as needed.
Interact & coordinate with other members of the AGG team in other locations
Qualifications

Post secondary education would be an asset.
At least 5 years experience in an administrative support role.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with individuals at all levels of the organization and within the communities the AGG operates.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines.

Sojourn Signs is a 3M Certified Sign Fabricator focused on producing top quality graphics and signage products and accessories. We specialize in regulatory and construction signs. In addition, we offer products specific to the road construction industry, signage products, traffic control products, arrowboards, crash trailers, and other related products for the past 34 years.

We are a group of passionate professionals who pride ourselves on producing top quality products. We are looking for a mature, career-oriented team member who is self-motivated, detail-oriented, flexible, reliable and not afraid to think outside of the box.

Successful candidates for this position will be a strong, disciplined self-starter with strong relationship-building skills specifically in the signage and traffic industries. They will be responsible for working as part of our production team and assisting with substrate cutting and prep, packaging and shipping.

Are you that person?

Job Summary:

Some Duties of a Sign Fabricator/Shop Assistant include:

Assist team with sign production
Maintaining organizing and preparing substrates for vinyl application
Cutting sign substrates
Picking/packaging orders for shipping
Shipping completed orders
Skills / Education / Experience:

Candidate must read, write and speak English
High School diploma or equivalent preferred
Requires frequent sitting, standing, balancing, bending or stooping for prolonged periods of time
Previous sign installation/service and vinyl experience is preferred, but not necessary. We are willing to train the right candidate
A valid driver's license (Class 5 or higher) with a clean driver's abstract is preferred, but not required
Personal qualities:

Strong work ethic
Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service
Good trouble-shooter / problem solver - even-tempered
Solutions-oriented
Possess a "Make-it-happen" attitude
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, dependable, on time, and self-motivated
Very organized and able to manage time effectively
Ability to perform work duties inside/outside in all weather conditions
Desire to learn and grow
A good sense of humour
 

We Offer:

Medical plan

On-going training for success and career development

TO APPLY:

Who we are:

Choquette CKS, a division of Heritage Food Service Group of Canada, is one of the largest service providers for the food service industry in eastern Canada. We have over 100 years of history, and our licensed, factory-trained technicians minimize downtime and prioritize urgent service. In addition, we have an extensive support team to drive service excellence and we maintain a sizable inventory of OEM parts. We are the industry leader in Canada, and we care beyond service!

A day in the life:

Our qualified Refrigeration Journeymen repair and maintain refrigeration equipment. Typical refrigeration equipment includes display cases, walk-in coolers/freezers, reach-in and undercounter coolers/freezers, ice machines, and reach-in blast chillers. If you can service hot as well as cold commercial food equipment that is a bonus! Typical cooking equipment (gas, steam, and electric) examples: dishwashing equipment, ranges, fryers, steamers, and combi-ovens and more. If you are not currently certified, we will support your future training and educational goals. Your role will use your industry knowledge to service complex equipment, while providing exceptional customer service to our customers - you get to be the HERO every day!

What you bring:

Education in appliance service, or a related field is preferred
5 years' experience as a refrigeration technician
313A is required
G1, G2, G3 is an asset but not required
Experience diagnosing and trouble-shooting commercial refrigeration equipment
Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude
Valid driver's license with a relatively clean driving record
Excellent customer service and communication skills, accountable and self-driven
Must be available to work overtime and participate in the on-call rotation
Able to occasionally travel to work at other locations as needed, or travel for training purposes
Why work for us?

Industry-Leading Compensation
Our hiring range is broad to reflect the skillset of each technician
Each day brings new challenges and endless learning opportunities
Comprehensive Group Benefits and Pension Program
Extended health, dental and LTD
All technicians receive a company vehicle, specialty tools and uniforms
Training and Development Opportunities
Industry-leading OEM manufacturer training for our technicians to keep up to date with industry knowledge
In-house and on-the-job training provided on a variety of kitchen equipment
We continue to invest in developing our employees, potentially having gas schooling or refrigeration apprenticeship compensated
24/7 Resources and Support
You will be supported by parts/service specialists, dispatchers, customer service representatives and field service leaders
Superior Scheduling
Our operation is year-round with no seasonal downtime
Industry leaders in Canada
You will be part of a growing, stable organization, who is the industry leader in Canada
We are committed to ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. We are committed to treating people with disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We are an equal opportunity employer that supports diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We put safety first, and deliver service excellence with integrity, from a team-driven, collaborative mindset. We support community, both internally and externally.
