North West Hospital and Health Service (HHS), Queensland, Australia.

Unique locations
Friendly communities
Regional, rural and remote $$$ incentives
Have you considered the diverse career experience, financial benefits and lifestyle options on offer by taking on a role with the North West Hospital and Health Service?

Working with us (all amounts in AUD$)

for 1 year will get you an isolation bonus of $3,500. If you stay for 2 years you will get $10,500… and for your 3rd year (and every year after that) you will get $7,000.
base salary rates between $80,342 and $103,053 p.a. (Nurse Grade 5)
12.75% employer superannuation contribution.
Additional leave options include: purchased, long service, sick, parental, maternity, or adoption leave.
Tax savings through salary sacrificing options are also available (refer to https://www.health.qld.gov.au/employment/conditions/salary/sacrifice).
In your downtime, we will provide 2 return airfares p.a. (inc. spouse/dependents) to the nearest east coast provincial city in conjunction with your recreation leave; of which we offer 5 weeks p.a. with a 17.5% loading/bonus.

Professionally, our HHS values professionalism, leadership capability, excellence and resilience in our staff. We are committed to providing extraordinary opportunities for career development including in-house training, development and mentoring programs, and 2 weeks p.a. plus travel as required and enrolment and conference costs for approved courses and conferences.

The lifestyle in Mount Isa is family friendly; it is a vibrant city with an outback community feel. You will fall in love with the natural splendour of the North West Queensland region, the experience of a rural/urban community and the opportunity to make a real and positive difference... and want to stay.

https://discovermountisa.com.au/

We also offer staff accommodation (if available) or a private rental subsidy of $82.50 per week for up to 17 months.

Transfer and appointment expenses may be negotiated.

Mount Isa is a great place to live and work!

About the role

This is a talent pool for upcoming permanent full-time vacancies working as part of the Nursing and Midwifery Workforce Unit.

Role is 76 hrs p.f. and has the opportunity to experience a broad range of clinical practice areas across multiple facilities within the North West HHS.

Our unique demographic and extensive geographical reach provide an opportunity to develop, promote, and foster continuing professional development.

You will be allocated to work units according to organisational requirements to cover staffing shortages within the North West HHS.

Requirements

Mandatory requirements are a relevant tertiary degree qualification and appropriate registration/licences.
Please refer to https://www.nursingmidwiferyboard.gov.au/Registration-and-Endorsement.aspx for registration requirements in Australia.
Travel is a requirement of this role.
Pre-employment screening will be conducted for the successful candidates.
This is a VPD risk role: Hepatitis A/B, Measles, Mumps, Rubella, Varicella, Pertussis, Tuberculosis and COVID-19.
A 6-month period of probation may apply.
Interested?

Visa sponsorship may be available for suitable candidates.

Download the Role Description for further information and application / interview preparation.

Contact: Checille Naig 07 4744 7166.

Applicants will be assessed throughout the advertising process and roles filled as FTE becomes available.

 

Permanent roles available for skilled applicants wanting to relocate to Australia. Visa sponsorship may be available.

TO APPLY:
Apply online at any time.

https://smartjobs.qld.gov.au/jobs/QLD-MI482101

GoGeomatics Canada is looking for an enthusiastic Marketing and Event Coordinator to engage with national and international audiences of geospatial specialists. The remote position provides an opportunity to immerse yourself in a hands-on, lead role in our marketing and events.

Who We Are

We are the largest and most popular events and communications hub promoting the Canadian geospatial sector. We communicate on topics within the high-tech sector related to mapping, earth observation, surveying, BIM, digital twins, analytics, and location intelligence. GoGeomatics is the hub connecting the spokes of individuals, companies, communities, geography, education, events, news, jobs, science and technology. With over 10 years of success, GoGeomatics continues to grow and empower the Canadian geospatial sector. We produce in-person events such as GeoIgnite, Canada's national geospatial conference in Ottawa, and the GoGeomatics Expo Canada's Geospatial Technology Trade Show in Calgary. We also organize online events and Meetup networks with events coast to coast.

What You Are Looking For

An opportunity to make a real measurable difference in people's lives and organizations' successes. 
A professional challenge that will test your abilities and give you a path to level up your experience and skillsets.
A small team environment where we work together and support each other.
You want to work on successful and meaningful outcomes, not billable hours.
What You Will Be Doing

The Marketing and Event coordinator reports directly to the Managing Director. Providing support across all activities, the marketing and event manager is responsible for the planning, production, promotion, and overall coordination of high-profile events. We are looking for someone to lead fresh, community-facing campaigns utilizing a diverse perspective. This role manages our relationships with other media and association partners, to bring our content, services, and events to the largest possible audience for the benefit of the community.

 

What You Have Accomplished/Gained Throughout Your Career:

Ability to create and execute marketing campaigns
A proven track record in developing and executing events
Experience in conducting post-event analyses and reports
Established strong relationships with clients, stakeholders, and team members
Proven ability to identify and mitigate risk, and propose and deliver solutions
Confident and effective communications skills
Strong desire to achieve results and goals
Attention to detail and deadlines
You take ownership of outcomes
Ability to thrive in high-pressure situations, and manage multiple projects, events, requirements and priorities
Exceptional knowledge of and experience with social media campaigns and management
Proficiency in Zoom or other digital event platforms and logistics
Ability to work remotely
Requirements

A minimum of three years in marketing and events
Degree/Diploma in Event Management/Public Relations/Marketing
Candidates based in Canada, in EST time zone.
This position is suitable for someone with 4-6+ years of experience.

TO APPLY:
Please send a cover letter and resume to us that clearly explains how you meet the requirements of this position.

E-mail: jmurphy@gogeomatics.ca

Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

document:
Who we are

At Shoplogix, we are on a mission to create something extraordinary: a world-class global IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things) software company that delivers real-time, 24/7 impact to manufacturers around the globe.

We empower our clients in 32 countries with information and insights to advance their operational excellence strategy. Our cloud-based performance management solution delivers real-time visual tracking and analysis of production, integrates powerful reporting capabilities, and accelerates continuous improvement. 

Who we need

Reporting to the Manager of Software Development, we are looking for a Software Architect who wants to bring their expertise in the design and development of complex products deployed to AWS, to play a lead role on our team. 

What's in it for you

Exposure, impact and influence. You will be a senior member of a collaborative and agile team responding to the needs of manufacturing clients with the technology to optimize their business and grow their revenue. You will see your ideas come together and go live as you contribute to solving real-world problems.

Cutting-edge technology. Our software takes I/O signals directly through OPC, Modbus and other industrial communications protocols from the factory floor. It pushes them up to our cloud services, which provide a real-time conduit for our web reporting, mobile apps, media displays and notification engine. We use the latest versions of modern frameworks. These include AWS (EC2, RDS), HTML5, ES6 JavaScript utilizing React.js / Flux, Python, C#, RESTful web services, Go, PostgreSQL, Powershell, Bash, Kubernetes and Docker. 

How you will make an impact:

Create in-demand product features. You will architect and build the framework of our solutions and new releases. You will design, develop and deploy new features and modules. You will increase your understanding of our products and continuously grow your knowledge in IIoT. 
Set exceptional standards through collaboration. You will introduce and implement guidelines and expectations for reliable quality code, lead peer code reviews and test automation, and ensure that each release meets our high-quality standards. You will propose optimizations for enhancing the reliability and speed of our platform.
Research and analyze. You will spearhead architecture discussions, presenting well-thought-out ideas and evidence for choosing a particular tool, process or method.
You will bring:

The technical expertise. You have experience building and deploying complex software solutions to the cloud and using modern frameworks such as AWS and .NET. You have experience with JavaScript utilizing React.js / Flux, Python, C#, RESTful web services, GIT or comparable repository software. 
The growth mindset. You are a critical thinker who can creatively solve problems while continuously pursuing knowledge. You have expertise across the full development life cycle working within an Agile Scrum or Kanban framework. You prioritize writing high-quality, readable, maintainable, well-commented and long-lasting code. You have an ongoing interest in staying ahead of the curve for modern frameworks and approaches. 
The collaborative approach. You can build trusting relations and efficiently guide the work of  in-person and remote teams. You are quick to identify when priorities need to shift and take feedback from both leaders and peers. You are comfortable with ambiguity and willing to figure things out when no clear, defined path or process is outlined. 
Why join? 

Shoplogix is a division of Constellation Software, one of the largest and most successful software companies in Canada and the most successful technology stock in Canada over the last 10 years [TSE: CSU]. We are in a unique position with the long-term and full backing of Constellation Software, including access to their best practices and career opportunities. At the same time, we have a highly entrepreneurial and dynamic culture as a fully autonomous company.

This is the chance to get in on the ground floor as we lead the manufacturing industry's digital transformation on a global scale. With a focus on continuous innovation and making data accessible and actionable, we use the latest technologies to build IIoT solutions that solve everyday problems. We take great pride in our first-class team and inclusive, collaborative culture, fostering an open-door approach at all levels. With access to mentorship and best practices, our environment is one where everyone can share ideas, build knowledge, learn from each other and contribute to their career and our success as a company.

And, when COVID-19 pandemic restrictions are lifted and gathering no longer poses a threat, we look forward to returning to some of the fun we have outside of work, including: weekly indoor/outdoor soccer games, movie nights, mountain biking team races, indoor climbing gym near the office, frisbee golf, beach volleyball and golf tournaments for the whole office.

Apply now

Diversity and inclusion are not mere words on paper to us. We welcome and appreciate candidates with a range of backgrounds and experiences. If you have 70% of the qualifications we are looking for, and want to play an integral role changing an industry, apply to express your interest. 

Shoplogix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

TO APPLY:
If you have the skills and experience required for this position, please forward your resume to:

E-mail: careers@shoplogix.com

https://jobs.peopleready.com/jobs/Belleville/PR-1365594/Janitor

We are an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religious affiliation, color, national origin, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, or disability.



About Us:

RG Henderson a division of Heritage Food Service Group of Canada Limited, is the largest commercial kitchen equipment OEM parts distribution company in Canada. We are a customer focused institution seeking individuals who are excited about becoming part of our dynamic and team-oriented work environment. In Canada alone, we have seven distribution warehouses which give us the opportunity to provide national parts supply solutions to all industry participants. We are the leader within our industry and are looking for those eager to join our family. Our company is growing rapidly and we are looking for talented candidates who want to grow and learn in our evolving organization.

Position Summary:

In the role of Summer Intern, the primary responsibility is to ensure that every part that enters or leaves our warehouse is handled with care. The Summer Intern's main responsibility will entail picking, tagging and putting away various parts. This role will report into the Customer Service Manager, and will be working closely with the Inventory Controller. The position houses full time hours and competitive wages.

Responsibilities Include:

Receive and count incoming parts, ensuring accuracy between the physical count and packing lists or purchase order quantities
Accurately record received part information into computer based inventory management system
Accurately read purchase orders and pick the correct parts quickly and correctly
Identify part location and label item with correct barcode
Accurately shelf parts in correct warehouse location
Assemble customer orders, picking parts, confirming part numbers and quantities
Qualifications:

Positive attitude and team work is a must
Warehouse experience is an asset but not an absolute
Ability to:
Adapt to change and quick turn around
Work in a high pressure, fast paced environment
Learn and understand our computer system
Continuously stand and walk on concrete surface
Intermittently lift 50 lbs unassisted
Strong:
Attention to detail and accuracy
Time management, organization and multitasking abilities
Attendance record and punctuality
Team orientated and customer service approach to work
TO APPLY:
For more information or to apply now, you must go to https://rghenderson.prevueaps.com/jobs/247792-57199.html

Please DO NOT email your resume to us as we only accept applications through our website.
